0.content:
Trust me...I know what I'm doing...

"Pfft, did you see the look on his face?!" Lauren said, unable to hold back the laughter.

"He looked like he was going to start bawling!" Natalie chimed in, also laughing.

"I can't believe we actually went through with it," Sarah shouted.

"He looked so frightened," Amy said from behind the wheel. "But it was just so adorable!"

"Thanks for getting us into the store, Amy," Lauren said from the back of the van with the other girls.

"No problem; Happy Birthday," Amy said as she drove them back to Lauren's house.

"Yup, I couldn't have done it without you girls," Lauren said. "And of course, my little twerp brother, Mark. He's in for a real surprise tomorrow." Lauren began to chuckle, darkly.

"Pfft; I knew you'd cave," Natalie said. "There was no way you were going to abandon him there."

"Well it IS just for the night," Lauren said. "After all, I haven't had my fill of fun yet. And my brother is just the right kind of toy to play around with." Lauren's words got the girls laughing again...except for the fifth girl...

Katie so far had been quiet. She'd partaken in the games and prank they pulled on Mark that night, but ever since they left the house, she was uneasy. She didn't think that Lauren would actually go through with it...She couldn't help but feel bad for Mark; Hell, technically speaking, in some countries, what they did was considered as "Slave-Trading." And she felt really bad about it.

"Hey girls...Um...You don't think we might've crossed a line, do you?" she asked them. Suddenly all the girls slowed their laughing and looked at her.

"What do you mean?" Sarah asked. "We're just having good fun..."

"Yeah, it started out as fun," Sarah said. "But...I can't help but feel like we've gone too far with this. I mean, Mark didn't seem like he was having any fun at all. And we just left him there at the store..."

"Oh please, I'm going back for him," Lauren said. "Besides, no matter how much he struggled, I know that he's enjoying this deep down, the little perv."

"Yeah, but I don't think Mark is ever going to trust you ever again after tonight, and he's going to be really mad when we let him out of there," Katie said.

"The little shrimp is too weak to do anything about it; let him fume," Lauren said. "Besides...who says we ARE going to let him out."

Katie's eyes went wide with fear when Lauren said that.

"Wait, you don't mean," Natalie began to say.

"Just because I said I'd pick him up from the store tomorrow, doesn't mean I'm done playing with him," Lauren said. "Nope, I think I'm going to enjoy my new toy for a long time coming."

Lauren's words were starting to scare Katie; how far was she willing to let this go? She first started to get nervous when they revealed the box, and the life-sized doll they'd taken from inside of it. Lauren dressed it up just like Mark...It was disturbing. Now it sounded like she was legitimately thinking that the doll could replace her brother. How would she...Then the solution came to Katie.

"But what about when your parents find out? You said they'd be coming back tomorrow. They're not going to fall for it," Katie said.

"Oh my parents already know about it," Lauren said. That threw all of the girls. "Yeah, when I told them my plan, they thought it would be funny; they were all for it. In fact, they'll be taking me to the store to get him tomorrow. And afterwards, Mom and I are going to walk him around town, just to embarrass him further, while dad converts his bedroom to a nursery. Besides, it's MY birthday after all...Why shouldn't I get what I want? And I ALWAYS get what I want..."

Katie was taken aback by all of this. The thought of her parents actually condoning what they'd done, but also enabling it made her stomach flip. The girls were returning to their half-drunk laughing-fest, while Katie legitimately thought she'd throw up. How could Lauren be THIS cruel over an accident? To treat her own brother like this? And what's worse is, Katie herself helped her do it. She thought that it was just a harmless little game between them. Part of her couldn't believe that she'd let them out of the house when they did it...but now, she was legitimately scared...What would Lauren do to HER if she objected? If her parents were in on it, she'd have an easier time getting away with it...And what scared Katie even more, what if HER own parents condoned what happened to her as well...It was frightening. And through all of the fear she was experiencing, she thought about how Poor Mark must've experienced it too...only much, much worse...

--

The girls were soon back at Lauren's place, drinking and having laughs over Mark's expense. The girls were drinking again; Katie in particularly, to try and stop shaking from her adrenaline fear. However, during the Girls' horseplay, Lauren accidentally spilled a beer all over her top.

"Ugh; well that's just great," Lauren said as her beer soaked shirt began to cling to her chest.

"Whoo - Wet T-Shirt contest!" Natalie shouted.

"Yeah right," Lauren said dismissing the contest. "My parents will kill me if we stain the floors. I've got to get out of this thing."

"Yeah, free show!" Sarah said.

"Take it off!" Amy said.

"As if, you hos," Lauren said standing up. "I'm going to go get changed. Be right back."

Lauren walked off to her bedroom to grab a spare top. Pulling the shirt over her head made her realize just how tipsy she was. She was starting to worry she'd be too hung over to go pick-up Mark tomorrow. Not that she really cared; the little twerp deserved what he got. Now that she was in her new top, she looked across her room and noticed her collection of Dolls. They were her absolute favorite; cute little stuffed baby rag-dolls, all wearing different outfits; they were her prized collection. And at the center of bunch was her first and all time favorite doll...Lala, a doll in a frilly pink petticoat and a diaper, and her hair in twin tails with cute ribbons and a bow. However, this particular doll, unlike the others, was missing one button-eye.

Lala was the first "dolly" that her father ever bought her on her birthday when she was a little girl. And ever since, Lala was her favorite toy and prized possession. That was until just a few days ago, thanks to that little twerp, Mark. She occasionally liked messing with him from time to time, so while he was wasting time playing video games, she asked him to come to her room and help move her dresser for her. She of course left him to do all the heavy-lifting. Too bad the little-shrimp was so pathetically weak that he dropped the dresser right on top of Lala, breaking her poor eye.

Lauren smirked as she went over to Lala and picked her up, holding her close to her face.
"I got him back, Lala...I made him pay for what he did to you. He's going to serve as your replacement for a while. Now he'll know what it's like..." Lauren gave Lala a light kiss, before putting her back down and turning to leave.

"Lauren..." she heard a light, high-pitched, little girl voice say. She spun around fast and saw no one there. For a moment, she considered that it was just her imagination, when she heard it call again. "Lauren..."

"...Lala?" Lauren asked.

"It's me, Lauren," Lala said. This didn't seem possible; Lala didn't even have a voice-box; there was no way she could talk.

"Okay, the girls must've spiked my drink with PCP or something," Lauren said. "Or maybe I'm dreaming."

"I'm not a dream, Lauren...I'm talking to you," Lala said...and this time, Lauren saw the seam that served as Lala's smile come apart, opening up her mouth and moving like a muppet. "We need to talk, Lauren."

"Lala...You can talk?!" Lauren said now picking Lala up. "H-How, why?!"

"We've always been able to talk, Lauren," Lala said. "We just haven't needed to say anything until now. We can see and hear all the things you do, ever since you brought us home."

"We?" Lauren said.

"The others, Lauren...All of us," Lala said. Before her very eyes, Lauren saw the other dolls in her collection suddenly move. They lifted their blank faces and stared at her. "We've been watching you, playing with you...all your life, since you got us. And tonight...you've made us very unhappy, Lauren."

"What? What - what did I do?"

"You broke one of the rules, Lauren," Lala said - her small girlish voice was starting to sound creepy and threatening. "You crossed the line; violated the sacred barrier between People and Toys...What you did to your brother...it was wrong, Lauren."

Lauren's eyes widened. Her toys were starting to talk to her, and were upset with her after what she did to Mark.
"B-b-but, but...It was just a prank. We're just having fun..."

"Your brother didn't look like he was having fun, Lauren...He clearly didn't like what you did to him. And now, he's scared, and alone, knowing that his own sister has betrayed him...abandoning him in a cold dark store."

"Well it might be harsh but," Lauren tried to justify. "I did it to get back at him for what he did to you; he broke your eye..."

"What he did was an accident Lauren...a mere accident, easily repaired. But what you did to him. You broke your relationship with him, in a way that can't be fixed, Lauren. He's never going to trust you, ever again. But more importantly, you violated some of the sacred rules; treating your own brother as a mere object...as a toy. We are Toys, Lauren...we were made for this. Your brother is a human. There are rules about what you...and your friends did."

"What do you mean, 'rules'? Sacred? What are you saying?" Lauren asked.

"You'll see soon enough, Lauren...But for now...You need to be punished."

What happens now?

02.content:
Lauren was very frightened by what Lala was saying. Right now, she was hoping that if this was a dream or a hallucination, that she'd come out of it. All of this was so nuts, she couldn't believe any of it; her Dolls were alive and they were displeased with how she'd treated her brother. This was crazy. But Lala didn't say anything else, and her blank expression and cold, dead remaining button eye served to unnerve Lauren even more.

Lauren flinched when she heard one of the girls scream from out in the living room. She rushed to the door of her bedroom and went down the hallway to the living room where the slumber party was. Her eyes were wide and her mouth was agape with terror; the life-sized doll that she'd made-up to resemble Mark...She'd left it on the couch, as one last "surprise" for Mark so he'd realize just how far they were willing to take this "game" of theirs. The girls had enjoyed gawking at it, making fun of it, and pretending that it WAS the real Mark; talking to it, flirting with it even...

...It was standing up. It was looking from girl to girl in the living room, with it's glassy, painted eyes. Slowly it turned its head toward the hallway, completely disregarding the limits of the joint and turning a full 180 degrees to look directly at Lauren with its blank smile. She stood there shivering, terrified of what she saw.

"Grab her," Lala suddenly said. Lauren flinched when suddenly the life-sized doll came rushing towards her, snapping its head back around and coming at her with its arms raised. Lauren screamed and tried to retreat, only to stumble into the wall. The doll grabbed her arm. This was a true nightmare; she was getting over the shock of realizing that Lala and the Dollies were alive; she didn't take the time to consider what this thing could do if it was alive.

The moment the hand gripped her wrist, she realized just how strong it was. She screamed for her friends to help her, before the doll suddenly seized her throat with its free hand. Lauren was choking, but the Doll merely tilted its head, curiously and it's frozen, plastic expression gave it a terrifying look of indifference to her suffering. The doll was so powerful that it actually lifted Lauren off her feet and held her in the air.

Natalie and Sasha sprang to their feet and rushed toward the Mark-doll. They threw their arms over his shoulders and tried to pull him away from Lauren. But the doll suddenly turned its torso on a joint, swinging its free arm and the subdued Lauren with him, smacking the girls away, they flew back toward the living room, where the other girls tried to help him. The Mark-Doll took a step and advanced into the living room, when suddenly the doors to Lauren and Mark's rooms from down the hall flung open.

The other girls were astonished to see that pouring out of the rooms were a small army of toys; most of them were made up of Lauren's Dolly collection, and the rest were various random toys that Mark had in his room - various GI Joes, Transformers, Dinosaurs. And even scarier, they were carrying rather long extension cords and one of them had a roll of duct-tape.

Suddenly the Mark Doll tossed Lauren into the group of girls who were now cowering, huddled in the middle of the living room as the toys began to surround them.

"What the Fuck is going on here?!" Katie asked.

"This, this can't be happening; why can't I wake up?" Amy asked.

"GET THEM!" Lala shouted, ordering the army of toys to advance on the girls. Out of nowhere a flood of plastic and plush felt material washed over the girls, practically burying them. They felt tiny little hands grabbing at their fingers and pulling their hair. Surprisingly strong and heavy forms grabbing their arms by the wrists, pulling them behind them and forcing them to roll over. The Mark Doll stood over Lauren now that she'd been pinned, with her arms behind her back, and took the extension cord from one of the other toys. It began to bind Lauren at the wrists.

Suddenly a small plastic boot descended into Lauren's field of vision. When she looked up, she could see a GI Joe figure standing over her, scowling. It's plastic face moved with each expression; so uncanny, so frightening.
"You! You are an absolute disgrace, you little brat! How dare you do that to our Mark?!" the army-man scolded her.

"It's alright, Joe," Lala said emerging from the chaos surrounding the girls. "They'll get what they deserve soon enough."

"Look! They come with accessories!" one of the dolls said, carrying one of the girls' purses toward them. "They'll be fun."

"What's going on?! Why is this happening?!" Katie asked, before a transformer toy slapped a piece of duct-tape over her mouth, silencing her. Before each of the girls knew it, they were all tied up and gagged with duct-tape, and now sitting in a group against the couch in the middle of the living room.

Lala stood at the head of the army of toys.
"You girls are guilty of violating the sacred bonds of family, the sacred bonds of friendship, and most heinously, the sacred bond between Man and Toy-kind. You violated these trusts by effectively kidnapping a young man, holding him against his will, and effectively trying to make him into a Toy. Not only did you use this boy for your own amusement, but you abandoned him out in the world, where he could easily be taken outside of your ability to retrieve, just to humiliate him."

Katie was listening to all of this in abject horror. Somehow or another, these toys were alive and were punishing them for what they did to Mark. Her heart sank and she turned white; she knew that they'd be in deep trouble for this. She assumed that Mark would be psychologically traumatized for what they did. But now, they were being subjected by a tribunal of toys, having violated some sacred rules that the Toys held dear, that they didn't know about...Or maybe they did know, but they trampled on them anyway.

"Mark was not meant to be a toy; his frail human brain cannot handle the psychological implications of what being a toy entails. For this, you girls have most likely caused irreparable damage to him. Most importantly, you girls made a mockery of toy-culture, violating the sacred trust between a child and their toys, and destroying the trust between a brother to his sister and friends. For this we find the five of you; Lauren, Natalie, Amy, Sarah, Katie - guilty as charged on all accounts."

The girls were frightened now and continued to struggle against their restraints. Lauren pitched herself forward and looked directly at Lala with her pleading eyes, that were on the verge of tears. She tried to speak through her tape, but the sound was muffled.
"Mla-la...Pmwsss!"

"Oh? You think that you'll garner sympathy, or mercy from me? Because of our history, our relationship? Unfortunately Lauren, you've put me in a position where I have no choice but to be objective. As your first toy, it's my responsibility to hold you accountable for these violations...And while I'm not supposed to take any personal stakes in this endeavor...You DID say that Mark's purpose in this "prank" of yours...was to Replace Me...Therefore, we sentence you to 'Rehabilitation,' until such time where it can be determined that yu have truly repented for your crimes against your brother and of toy-kind."

The girls were scared. What the hell did Rehabilitation mean to a toy? What were they going to do to her?

Lala then turned to the Mark Doll. "Go get the van started." Without question, the life-sized doll moved toward the front door. Before long the girls could hear the engine revving up outside. Lala then turned to some of the other toys. "Take them to the factory...Give them the treatment."

The treatment? What the hell could the treatment be?! The girls continued to struggle. Lala moved toward Lauren and stood on her bound knee. It was creepy seeing Lala move; it was so unnatural.
"Don't worry, Lauren. Very soon you will understand everything...and you'll have the chance to learn and improve from this."

The Mark Doll returned. Lala looked up at him. "Load them into the Van, and then take me with you to the front seat. We're going to find Mark and set him free."

The Mark Doll reached down and picked up Sarah and carried her out the door, to put her in the back of the van. It returned and grabbed Natalie next. While it was working, Lala moved toward Katie, who had fallen on her side. She was frightened when Lala was in front of her, staring at her.

"You...We were watching you," she said. "You hesitated when it began. You know...don't you? You feel the fear that Mark now knows...You're sorry for what you and the others did to him." Katie slowly began to nod her head. She meant it, and part of her hoped it would get her out of this. "Good...then we'll depend on you. When rehabilitation begins, we'll use you as our liaison with Mark. We're going to need you to help him understand the rules, and help get him through this...It's going to be rough on everyone."

Katie's eyes widened. What the Hell did the doll mean by that? Suddenly Katie felt dozens of small felt and plastic hands grab her undersides and lift her off the ground. She found herself being carried by a group of dolls to the van, where she was unceremoniously thrown into the back of the van, on top of Lauren and Sarah. Fortunately she'd landed on Lauren's considerable chest to soften the fall. But now all the girls were squirming about in the back of the van, trying to get free. Amy was thrown on top of them, and the doors were shut.

The toy army loaded into the van and the Mark Doll began to drive, taking them to their unknown destination.

How did the night get this bad?!

021.content:
Mark stood there uncomfortably as his arms and legs were bound to the cardboard walls. He initially thought that with enough force he'd be able to rip his binds straight through the cardboard and get free; but as it turns out the box was surprisingly strong, and he was just to weak to pull them free. With barely having any space in the box, he wasn't able to gain any leverage or apply any force against the wall. His face and mouth hurt as the straps of the gag pressed against his cheeks. Out of anything right now, he wished he could just reach up to the straps on the back of his head and undo the buckle. But it was no use.

Mark's eyes began to water as he stood there, looking through the plastic visor covering the front of the box. It exposed him to the outside world to the humiliation that was sure to come when the store opened in the morning. What's worse is, Mark was positioned in the Store's Display window, which meant he was looking out onto the street, meaning that everybody could see him. Mark couldn't believe that Lauren would actually do this to him. It started out rather harmless; just a game the girls were playing, and Mark felt he owed Lauren since it was her birthday. But then when she revealed the Box and the real doll that came with it, now dressed up like a mock-version of himself, that was when this game went too far. But then she and her friends loaded him up into the box and restrained his arms and legs before gagging him. They loaded him up into the van and drove him to the store.

The doll itself was a "Dolly-Wolly," a new line of life-sized toys that were incredibly life-like. Mark couldn't believe that Lauren could afford this, but his parents were quite well-to-do. What was really unbelievable is the lengths that she'd go to for this prank of hers. She had bought a doll that looked just like Lala, just to get her hands on an outfit to fit Mark. She dressed up the Doll as Mark, and then kept referring to Mark himself as her new Doll...one that she didn't quite like, so she wanted to take it back to the store and exchange it for another one. And that's how Mark found himself here...Amy worked at the store and managed to get them inside after closing. They put him up on display with the other life-sized dolls...and then they left him here.

What scared him even more, was what could be the last thing that Lauren said to him before leaving.
"Bye Dolly-Wolly! I might come back and buy you tomorrow...that is...if someone else doesn't buy you first!"

Mark realized that was a genuine possibility; that someone else might come, be fooled enough into believing he was a doll and buying him first. Part of him wondered what would happen AFTER that; if they'd freak out at seeing a human that's been dressed like a doll; maybe they'd help him file some kind of lawsuit against Lauren for this, or maybe they'd treat him like a doll just like Lauren and her friends did. There's a chance that he could be taken away and never see his family again.

He was about to start crying when he suddenly saw headlights appear and turn toward the store. It was the Van! Mark gave a sigh of relief; the girls were just joking and they came back for him. But he got a bit alarmed when he saw the person step out of the car. He could barely see who it was that stepped out of the van, due to the bright headlights pouring in. But he could tell by the silhouette, it wasn't any of the girls; it was a man!

Mark felt a bit worried at the idea that someone else was coming here. But they had arrived in the Girls' van and it was still too early for the store to open, so it wasn't an employee or a manager. Maybe it was his dad? Maybe they caught wind of what Lauren had did and came to rescue him?

Mark heard the door opening and before long, he felt something grab the box he was in and slide it off of the shelf in the display window. Mark watched as his view from the Box's visor changed to be turned away from the window and into the dark store. Suddenly Mark felt the restraints on his arms and wrists coming undone; they were setting him free!
As soon as Mark's hands were free, he immediately went for his gag; he undid the buckle and loosened the straps, pulling the damn thing off his face, with a stinging sensation in his cheeks as they adjusted to their freedom from the pressure they were under. Mark looked down at hit and glared...The gag was a Pacifier; he was certainly going to get back at Lauren for dressing him up like a giant baby. No; not a baby...a doll!

The box's flaps were then undone shortly after Mark's legs were freed. Mark immediately rushed out of the box, dropping the pacifier gag onto the ground, coughing. He was so glad to breathe air that didn't have cardboard particles in it.
"Thank you! Oh thank you so much!" Mark said turning. "I know that all of this is hard to explain but - WHAAAAA?!"

Mark turned around to meet himself standing there; only it wasn't himself - it was the doll that Lauren made-up to look like him, staring back at him with the empty plastic eyes and painted on smile. It tilted its head, curious to Mark's reaction. Mark on the other hand was believing that he had in fact lost his mind after this experience.

"Calm down Mark, don't worry; we're here to help you," Mark heard a high pitched voice say. Mark had been backing away from the living doll so much that he eventually stumbled in the play-heel shoes Lauren had put on him. Fortunately the diaper the girls had put him in was padded enough to absorb his fall. When he fell he suddenly spotted something that terrified him even more than his plastic counterpart. It was Lala - Lauren's favorite doll - standing by its feet.

"Lala?!" Mark asked breathlessly. He was terrified seeing the doll move toward him; it was the creepiest thing he'd seen all night, so unnatural. He saw that Lala was still missing one of her button eyes; the one he'd broke. He tried backing away, expecting the worst.

"Take a deep breath Mark," the doll said, moving its mouth like a hand puppet. "We set you free; we've come to rescue you."

So many questions were going through Mark's head. "What? How? Why? Where?! I must've cracked; you're toys."

"Just calm down, Mark," Lala said. "Yes we are toys, and that will be hard to explain. What you need to know now, is that we saw what Lauren and her friends did to you...and it upset us greatly. Which is why we came to help you."

"You're mad at Lauren and not me?" Mark asked. "B-b-but I...I uh...I broke your eye."

"Mark...that was an accident," Lala said bluntly. "Besides, you immediately apologized to Lauren for it and offered to fix me to try and make her feel better; you're a good brother, Mark. But despite all of that, what Lauren did was unacceptable. We had to undo what they did."

The big doll then moved toward Mark and offered its hand to him. Mark tentatively took it and the doll helped him up. It was strange; the cold plastic felt odd to hold, yet it had such a gentle grasp. The doll still creepily stared at Mark with that blank expression of its. Suddenly it lifted up its arms and began taking its shirt off.

"Uh, what's he doing?" Mark asked Lala.

"Oh? Dolly wants her clothes back," Lala said gesturing to Mark's outfit. "No offense to you, Mark; but Dolly doesn't like being a boy."

The Doll removed its wig that allowed it to resemble Mark, and Mark realized of course what that meant. He himself complied taking the wig the girls had put on him off, shaking his real hair free. He of course decided to comply with the doll; after all, it was wearing HIS clothes after all; seemed like a fair trade.

"Uh, the buttons for this thing are in the back, and I can't undo them," Mark said. "The girls didn't want me getting out on my own." Dolly moved toward Mark and began undoing the buttons. "Why doesn't 'Dolly' talk like you, Lala?"

"Dolly is a young-toy; new off the shelves. She's very shy about these things," Lala said. It wasn't long before Mark and Dolly had switched clothes and Mark was back to his old self again, save for the make-up the girls put on him. He smeared it trying to get it off.

"Ugh, this stuff doesn't come off that easily; I'll have to wash my face when I get home; and then I'll have some words for Lauren and the Bitch-Brigade!" Mark said.

"Don't worry about that, Mark; the make-up should be gone when you wake up tomorrow," Lala said. "And Lauren and her friends are being punished as we speak."

Mark didn't like the sound of that; Lala's squeaky voice saying something so dark and menacing was creepy.
"Punished? What do you mean?"

"You will see, but for now, don't worry about anything, Mark," Lala said. "When you wake-up tomorrow, most of everything will be as if tonight never happened. And you will have a package waiting for you in your room. Just be sure to follow the instructions, don't break the rules, and try to have fun."

Before Mark could ask another question, Lala spoke again. "And above all else Mark...Play Nice...remember, this is just as much your test as it will be for Lauren and her friends. But for right now...Its time for rest."

Lala's words were so threatening to Mark as he listened, wondering if his sister and her friends were alright. When suddenly he felt the heavy plastic hand of "Dolly" come down on his shoulder at the curve of his neck, striking him hard. And he passed out.

--

Lauren and the girls were tied to chairs in a warehouse, their gags were removed. They screamed for help when they could, but no one came. They wondered what the toys were going to do to them. Slowly they saw the army of toys emerge from the darkness. They were carrying what looked like canisters of Lucite - a fast-hardening liquid plastic - and some had electronic voice-boxes. And as they approached the girls...they were chanting.

"One-of-Us, Goo-Ball-Goo! One-of-Us, Toy-Box-Crew! One-of-Us, Goo-Ball-Goo! One-of-Us, Toy-Box-Crew!"

15 year-old Ryan Jordan was going through that special time of life that every teenage boy goes through: puberty. All of a sudden, girls he would normally just talk to casually he blushes around, and he's been increasingly more interested in the female form as a whole. So much, in fact, that one day he sees a bunch of cute female figurines at a run-down but reliable shop one day he frequently visited, wanting to buy one.

In the window of the shop, known as "Mr. Johnson's Shop of Strange and Wonderful Things", he could easily see the five beautiful figurines, all of which were very detailed, right down to having actual fabric for their clothes. He even found it cute that there were all lined up in alphabetical order, starting with Amy to the far left and ending with Emelia to the far right. Ryan had a difficult time deciding which one to get, but with the price tag as is (almost 100 dollars), he could only afford one. He had previously saved up the money to buy some new video games, but Ryan's hormones got the best of him and he bought one of the figurines in a heartbeat, with the store keeper swiftly putting it in the box it came in.

As Ryan picked up the Amy figuirne, and as he was given a plastic bag to put it in, the store keeper gave the boy one last thing to go with it. It looked like a black box, a perfect 5-inch square, and with it an instruction book entitled "getting the most of your new figurine purchase". Ryan looked very confused by the whole thing and prompted to ask the man what this was.

"Oh, it's simply a surprise for you, lucky customer", the old man giggled to himself. He then walked up to the front of the store and took the other four figurines you didn't buy and placed them in the bag as well, putting them all in their respective boxes first.

"Wait, are you giving me ALL of them!? But I don't have enough money for all five", the worried Ryan told the storekeeper.

"Don't worry about it, boy", the old man said to the boy, smiling with his teeth showing. "Those figurines have been there for months, and no one's once purchased them. Consider it a present from me to you as a valuable customer."

"Thanks", Ryan smiled in reply as he put the four in his plastic bag. The cheerful 15 year-old then ran quickly back home, which was only a few minutes walking distance away. He felt proud yet silly at the same time for his purchase, since Ryan never had dolls in his room growing up...aside from plush dolls of animals. To him, it was like he just purchased five Barbie dolls.

Still, Ryan had just lost a battle with his hormones, and the boy quickly ran into his house and went straight up to his bedroom. He cleared his bed of the magazines he had on it, placed his school bag in the right corner of the room, and sat down on his bed, putting down the plastic bag containing the figurines he had just purchased next to him.
