113312111.content:
As he started to enlarge Dara, Ryan found himself with Emelia still wrapped around him, and Amy rather blocking his path. Neither condition was a serious problem, but they reminded him he was in his room, and it was already full with just the two girls. Three might be a little much.

“It’s getting crowded in here. I’d best shrink you two so we can have a little room.” Amy makes no objection, but Emelia needed additional assurance he would still be protecting her. But then “Amy, 1 foot”, followed by “Emelia, 1 foot” and the two girls shrank to their new sizes, and reacted as predicted. After soothing Emelia, Ryan put both of them on his bed, along with Dara, and then said “Dara, 1 foot.”

A moment later, Dara is growing, and then looking at a huge Ryan, a fact that does not seem to greatly upset her. “May it please you I am named Dara. I am at your service, My Lord.” She then managed a quite graceful curtsy despite her high heels and the soft blanket she was standing on. To Ryan at least, her long red dress and long light blue hair made her seem quite the princess she was described as.

“I’m Ryan. Amy and Emelia here say I have rescued them from some danger that they can’t describe. Do you have any idea what it was?”

“I fear not, Lord Ryan. I too was rescued from something I dreaded very much, and am very grateful for your succor, but I can not recall what the danger was, nor how you rescued me, save that you did do it.” Turning to look at the other girls, she asked “Are these two to be my servants?”

“Huh? Oh, no, they are not servants.”

“Oh? Well, if you are thinking of making them your servants, may I inform your lordship they are untrained. I can teach them their duties if your lordship wishes.”

“No, they are not servants. Nobody is a servant here. There are no servants. And I am not a lord. There are no lords here either.”

“No servants? No lords? But that is impossible my lord. How could society exist? How can I?” Dara looked quite distressed.

It was Emelia who moved forward to offer assurance. “Now don’t worry my lady. You’re part of the toff, and the quality take care of their own.”

Dara looked puzzled “Toff? What is that?

Now Amy answers “I’m guessing, but I think she means you were born above the salt, well above it if I guess right, and she thinks the high and mighty around here will welcome you. She could be right, tho I’ve always deemed those types to be dangerous.”

Ryan interrupts “Anyway, I’ve been asking the other girls some questions to try and figure out what is going on, and I’d like to ask you some questions too.”

“As you please My Lord. I will do my best to answer correctly.”

But the answers were much the same. Anything about her background or history in general was met by some variation of “I am sorry My Lord, but I do not remember.” Still, from time to time she dropped hints which seemed to suggest she was born with a silver spoon in her mouth. [Ryan wondered vaguely just where that expression had come from, and a little more seriously if it meant the same as “toff” and “born above the salt”. It seemed likely.]

“OK, I guess that will do for now.” Ryan decides, and Dara once again curtsies in response to his remark. "We have two more girls to go. I hope one of them knows something.
113312111.title: Dara

1133121111.content:
Ryan selected Christina almost at random. He expected to enlarge the last girl shortly anyway, but the description of her as older seemed to imply she might know something the other doll would not. So maybe she would be the better choice. It was a reason anyway.

Once again the enlargement went according to schedule, and only again the resulting girl reacted differently. Despite being 1/5 his height, Christina somehow managed to look down at Ryan, somehow reminding him he was just a boy and she was a woman, or at least a lot closer to adult than he was. Her glance around the room was even more dismissive, as she muttered "antiquated dump".

"Hey! This is a great room."

Christina was not at all convinced of that. "Beggers can't be choosers, so I shouldn't complain. Very well, I apologize for any insult implied." There was no sign she had changed her opinion. "I am Christina. You are?"

"Ryan. Say, the other girls say I rescued them from something. Do you know anything about that?"

Christina paused to consider... "Not much. I was rescued from something terrible and you did it some way. But the rest is blank. Do they say anything different?"

"Not really. They can't recall much about their pasts. Can you?"

"No... I don't recall them at all, and as for my own past, I don't really remember anything."

"The others have made some interesting remarks when I asked them questions. Maybe you will too."

"It's worth a try. Ask..., but let's have your answers too."

"Huh?

"We are going to have to live in your world, right? So we need to learn about it far more than you need to learn about where we came from."

"I guess you have a point there. Let's see...
1133121111.title: Christina comes onstage

11331211112.content:
"Wait. There are more girls?" When Ryan confirmed there is one more, Christina continued, "Activate her first. She can answer at the same time as you and I do."

This seemed reasonable to Ryan. So he set the last doll, a brown-haired lass wearing glasses, and in a light pink dress, on the bed and went thru the same procedure as he had with the others. Same procedure [except for Christina muttering "Totally impossible.."] and once again, not quite the same result. This one...Berry?... seemed happy enough to be here, but rather nervous and quiet.

"I'm Ryan. You're Berry, right?"

"Ye..s." She seemed a bit tongue-tied. "I...want to thank you for rescuing me. It was very heroic of you."

"Oh? How?"

"I..." She closed her eyes and concentrated, apparently without success, "...don't know. ...I'm sorry..." Unlike the others who had shown little or no concern over their ignorance, Berry looked close to tears.

"Well, don't worry about it much. The rest of us couldn't remember anything either", Christina broke in with. Berry apparently hadn't noticed the other girls before. She looked startled and disappointed as she realized there were four other girls present.

"He rescued you, too?"

Christina ignored the lack of enthusiasm for this good deed and answered, "So we believe, but none of us has any idea how... or of much else it seems."

"I see...", Berry replied in a sad voice.

"Now we are trying to pool our rather limited knowledge", Christina continued to the worried girl. "So Ryan is going to ask some questions and give us some answers. You ready for that?"

Once Berry confirmed she was, the questions started, and revealed the situation was much the same for these two as well. They had no knowledge of their family, their society, history, location, etc. They might as well have been created out of thin air for the most part.

There were the differences again. They both professed to be familiar with computers, but when shown Ryan's desktop, Christina admitted she didn't even know how to turn it on. She seemed to feel that was the fault of the computer rather than her flaw. While Ryan was finding out nothing he could make use of, the girls found his own answers much more interesting and useful...
11331211112.title: Berry is out of the box

113312111121.content:
"Let's see" muttered Ryan. "My mother and dad are Rita and Frank Jordan. They are...actually I'm not too sure. They're officer workers of some sort, but I haven't paid much attention to what sort of paper they push. I have a sister, Ginger, age 8, and a brother, Hal, age 5. They are nice kids, but they are just kids. As for me..I'm a student at the local high school."

"You're a cleric?" Amy interrupts.

"What? No. I'm just a student, like everybody else."

"But you're as old as I am, and only clerics study at that age."

Another part of her past? Well, just correct her about the present, Ryan told himself.

"Maybe where you came from, but everybody goes to school here, and it won't be unusual if I am in school for 8 more years." This seems to silence Amy for the moment, so Ryan moved on to another subject.

"I'm doing pretty good in school. I don't really qualify as a nerd or a jock, but I may make the honor roll and I should make the team." He had to admit both claims were a tad optimistic. Still, neither was out of the question... completely anyway. Anyway, the girls looked suitably impressed..except for Christina, whose expression seemed a combination of "I don't believe a word of it" and "I going to hold you to that". Ryan wasn't sure which option worried him the more.

"Perhaps you should tell us how we came into your possession", Christina demanded. Ryan related the story of his visit to the store.

"So this merchant had us on display as little statues for months? And then just about forced us on you?" Only Dara didn't seem to feel this was rather odd.

"And you just bought us?" Amy asked. "That's not so heroic."

"Well, it did take all his money", Berry defended him. "That's something...a lot even. I read a book that started like that, and then... Well, I can't remember, but it was all very romantic." From her posture, it would seem she had quite enjoyed the book and had been quite into it. Christina has a different view.

"I find it interesting that this tale does not change at all my opinion that you rescued me and deserve my gratitude and loyalty. I would think it ought to, but it doesn't. Do you other ladies feel the same?" Nods all around confirm this.

"Interesting... I have a couple of ideas now, but they are pretty much just speculation..."
113312111121.title: Ryan tell his story

1133121111211.content:
"What are they?" Ryan asked.

"We girls seem to be from very different backgrounds, different times to be more exact."

Dara, Emelia, and Amy look rather blank at that. Berry broke in with "I read a book like that. It was very romantic and...", but again she found herself unable to recall any details. So Christina continued...

"Berry seems to be more or less contemporary with you, Ryan. Emelia may have been born 200 years ago, and Amy was born long before that."

"And when were you born?"

"Probably not for decades. I seem to be from well into your future."

"Huh? How do you figure that?"

"Over time, everything is made simpler to operate. What was once done by those with a lifetime of training is improved until the village idiot can use it. I can't recall how computers have been improved in my time, but you recall I mentioned I didn't know how to turn your's on. That's because I won't need to know how to turn one on. It will turn itself on. So I come from the future, even if I have very little idea what that future will be like.

"And Dara?"

"I think she means I need to alter the theory a little and make it even more fantastic. Dara, your hair color is natural, is it not?"

"Of course! It can't be faked!" Dara seemed rather proud of this.

"And none of you have seen blue hair, except out of a bottle, have you? Now if you will hold still while I take a closer look at your ear..." Dora made no objection and Christina got close and moved the hair out of the way before announcing... "Notice the point to her ear. I..."

"She one of the fair folk?" Amy broke in.

"She's an elf?" Berry asked. "But they don't exist...Tho I remember a really romantic story...Oh bother, I can't remember it either. This memory problem is so annoying."

Dara got quite worried. "Is there something wrong?"

"Wrong? There is hardly anything right with the situation!" Christina snapped, but continued with "About you in particular, no. Your past is simply a little more strange than ours, which are strange enough. In any case, our pasts are gone and we'll never see them again."

"You know, in my stories, when some character says that..." Berry started.

"This is not a story, and you had best not think of it as one." was Christina's retort. We have got to figure out we are going to live in a very strange land. I am sure Ryan here will help, but he is just a boy."

"Hey!"

"Well, you are, and you know it." Christina rounded on Ryan. "Moreover, you are in way over your head. You are going to need all the guidance you can get."

"Guidance...Say, what about the instruction booklet?"

"An excellent idea. Spread it out here where we can all read it."
1133121111211.title: Christina's idea of their background

11331211112111.content:
"So why should I let you read it? I'm bigger and I own you." Ryan was feeling uppity about Christina's remarks from earlier. That they were probably true just made them sting all the more. However, she was not having it. He towered far above her and could destroy her with a flick. A girl who lived her whole life among males who could slam her around without breaking a sweat. She couldn't let that worry her. She just had to remember not to fight him on his terms. So with fists on hips, she then began to say to Ryan:

"That is why you should let us. We are valuable, very valuable. You spent all your money for us and got a bargain, and you have no way to replace us. You need to be very careful with us: damage us and you hurt yourself. That means you need to know exactly how to take care of us, and so you need us reading the instructions too. Any thing you do not understand could be very costly."

"But..."

Christina silently let out a sigh of relief. All too often boys just could not be made to see common sense. If he had insisted, there would have been no choice but to bow to his will, and that would have been have been terrible. Maybe some of the others would not mind, or even like, being dominated by a man, but she doubted any woman anywhere would want to be dominated by a mere boy. But he was arguing on her grounds, and that meant he would end up doing as told. He might make a fuss and be a bother, but in the end, he would have to accept she was right. Now there is work to be done...

"No buts", Christina continued to tell Ryan. "We like you and we want to help you. And we can't do that if we don't know what is going on. So spread out that instruction booklet." With a sigh, Ryan did as told and spread out the sheets where all could read them, and they all set to work. Amy was the first to offer an opinion.

"Well, food won't be a problem. It says here you can shrink us down to where a spoonful is more than we can eat."

"But that seems terribly undignified", Dara objects. "We don't want to eat like peasants or barbarians." But Christina has a solution to that.

"It says here that anything we're holding or wearing shrinks or grows with us. So if we hold them while being shrunk, we will have the needed utensils. I doubt it will be completely dignified, but we won't have to behave like a bunch of boys." Ryan ignored that dig. Whether he tried to say silverware wasn't needed, or that he just hadn't thought of it, he was already sure Christina would make that sound bad. Better to just keep on reading...
11331211112111.title: The booklet says...

113312111121111.content:
"It also says that only the person who purchases the girls can change the height of them", Ryan continued to read to the tiny girls before him. "And that they can't shrink down more than 1/100th their original height or grow to more than 100 times their original height. It also says you can't change the size of the desired girl more than 5 times a day. Afterwards you must wait 24 hours before their height can be changed once again."

"Only one-hundredth the size we are now? We're already small, so that's pretty amazing", Christina gasped, fairly surprised by the booklet. "So let's see...if I'm 7 inches now, and if I grew to 700 inches tall, that would make me.."

"About 58 feet tall, plus a third of a foot", added Ryan, who pulled out a calculator to find out the exact height possible for the pushy doll. "Still, that's pretty tall."

"I guess, but it would be pretty interesting to be 100 feet tall", Emelia giggled to herself. "Provided that you were beside me, Ryan."

"Oh please", Amy sighed, annoying by the cutesy suggestion and voice of the blonde-haired girl beside her.

"Perhaps we should test this out", Ryan said to himself, putting the black box next to his lips. The girls below him, meanwhile, looked a little worried about what he was about to do. Everyone except Christina, though: she had an expression on her face that seemed to say, "Just get on with it already!"

"Amy, Berry, Christina, Dara, Emelia..."
113312111121111.title: The booklet also says..

1133121111211112.content:
"...Seven feet tall", Ryan ordered.

"Seven feet? Isn't that a bit more than can fit in this ro...?" Christina asked with a puzzled look, getting her answer before she could finish asking the question. The girls started to grow and rapidly become too big to fit onto the bed. As they continued to grow, they started pushing each other off the bed by sheer size. And Ryan found himself in the path of a feminine flood that rapidly knocked him to the floor.

Being under 500-1000 lbs [it felt like the higher figure, but Ryan was not clueless enough to mention that aloud] of girls has its burdens of course, but Ryan discovered it had some virtues too. Girls are nice, warm things to have next to you. And Ryan realized that when he had put out his hands to hold back the tide, they had ended up holding two very appealing objects.

"Get your hand back where it belongs!" That was Christina, which identified one of the lumps. Now who was the other? And was she just letting Christina speak for her? Or was she not objecting? Maybe he should wait and see if she does object. Or maybe he should just let go of Christina...if he was sure which one was her's. Or maybe..

"Now!" Christina demanded of Ryan. Maybe he should let go of both while he was still in one piece. Sadly this seemed the best idea, and the one he adopted to for Christina's satisfaction, if not necessarily to anyone else's.

Getting everybody to their feet was a complex operation, and Ryan lost track of just who had been where. Especially when he discovered that talking to a basketball height lass put his eye level at a rather distracting level, and having the full team in what was not a large room put an attractive set entirely too close to be ignored. The ladies were not as appreciative of the situation.

"This is way too crowded. We have got to get out of here", was Amy's comment, which allowed Ryan to work out it was Emelia's chest that was threatening to smother him. However that had to be ignored for now.

"No! We can't leave the room", Ryan told the annoyed Amy. His mother might have many virtues, but Ryan could recall all too many times she had said, "You're not old enough for that" and that thing he just had to have would not be bought, or would vanish into a closet until she reluctantly agreed he was old enough. He was pretty sure she would say the same about the girls, and the best that would happen would be his not seeing them for a year or more. Definitely best Mom not know anything until it was too late.

"But we can't stay like this", objected Dara, who was trying to sit on the ground, finding it hard to do.

"I'll...shrink you all to a more comfortable height that will fit in the room fine." With that in mind, Ryan grabbed the box and again pronounced, "Amy, Berry, Christina, Dara, Emelia..."
1133121111211112.title: Bigger is not always better

11331211112111121.content:
"...half an inch."

"No! That's too small..."

Again Christina's objection came too late as the girls were already shrinking. In a moment Ryan was "alone" in the room, and the women had "vanished".

"Where are you?" Ryan wondered aloud. His question was answered by silence..or by almost silence. Did he hear a female voice far away? Or a tiny voice right next to him? Ryan started to kneel down, but before he moved a foot, he realized he didn't know where the girls were, and could easily step on one with terrible results. So after recovering his balance, he tried a squat to get closer.

"What was that? I can't hear you."

This time he could hear something, noticing a small patch of blue. Looking closer, he saw it was Amy.

"I see you, Amy", he told her. "Let's see...now what?" Amy had a suggestion, but not at a volume that could let Ryan hear it clearly enough. He sighed to himself, annoyed that he could barely hear a thing the girl was saying.

"Well, why don't I put you on the bed until I can figure out something? That way, at least I won't step on you."

Amy seemed to find this reasonable, and quickly jumped onto the huge slab of meat that was soon next to her, despite parts of it being as thick as she was tall. When Ryan's hand reached the bed, she quickly got off and waved. Ryan next tried to find Emelia.

"She was right in front of me... Emelia, can you move and yell?" A moment later, Ryan noticed a patch of moving white, which proved to be Emelia. She too was offered a ride to the bed, but hesitated to climb aboard.

"Come on. I won't drop you", Ryan comforted the tiny girl, who finally got her to climb into his hand. But while Amy had stood up and watched the whole way, Emelia laid flat in the middle of the hand and kept her eyes covered until Ryan told her it was safe to get off.

Ryan then went back to looking for the others, a task made harder by his not being sure what colors the lasses had been wearing, and by the fear it would match the color of the rug anyway. Add in that the other girls were some distance away from him, and that he dared not move without extreme care for fear he would guess wrong about how far, and it was a long task.

He finally found Christina and Berry and transferred them to the bed, but where was Dara? Had he accidentally stepped on her? He was getting quite worried when he happened to glance at the bed and realized the girls were trying to tell him something.
Looking closer, he realized there were five figures. Dara must have been on the bed when she shrank.

By now Christina began organizing the others, and now a chorus of "Grow us!" was being shouted outloud. It was still only a whisper to Ryan, but he heard it, and he agreed. This was just too small a size for safety.

"Amy, Berry, Christina, Dara, Emelia..."
11331211112111121.title: Out of sight, but not out of mind

choices: Ryan tells his sister to stay out
113312111121111211.content:
"...3 feet tall."

A moment later the bed was crowded with 5 children [whose by no means childish figures disturbed Ryan's composure]. That was a lot better than when they were seven foot tall, but still the bed was fuller than it was comfortable.

"Maybe I had better make that two foot...", Ryan said to himself in response to the small figures, about to speak into the black box when Christina interrupted him.

"Hold it!" she warned him. "Count how many times you've changed us. Once to one foot, then to seven, down to 1/2 inch, and now to three. Whatever height you choose, we have to stay for the next day."

"Actually, he has done Emelia and me five times already," Amy corrected. "So I suppose we'll stay this height for a little bit."

"See? Already you have a problem", Christina continued. "Where are Amy and Emelia going to sleep? You can shrink the rest of us and we should be comfortable enough in our boxes, but Amy and Emelia are too big."

Or maybe too small. Sleeping with a five foot Amy and Emelia might be very crowded, but it definitely sounded appealing, and neither lass looked likely to complain. But three foot? That sounded wrong somehow, even if it wouldn't be as crowded and the girls still were not complaining.

"Well, maybe I can sleep on the floor...", Ryan suggested as Amy and Emelia shook their heads left and right in reply. They insisted he can have the bed, but the other three agreed he should be on the floor, which weren't exactly what his dreams of this sort of situation were like. Of course his dreams were rather vague on a number of points, but they sure didn't involve him sleeping on the floor.

"Now, let's get back to the instructions," Christina ordered Ryan. "And this time think before you act, or you may have more problems." But before Ryan could make out than the instructions, there was a bang on the door.

"Ryan? Are you in there?" a young voiced asked. It was Ginger, Ryan's younger sister, and odds were 50-50 that she would barge in in a second. Ryan started to wonder if he could hide the girls, but also wondered if he should simply tell his sister stay out of his room like she has been told lots of times [and sometimes even paid attention to].
113312111121111211.title: "..3 feet tall." has problems too

1133121111211112112.content:
For a moment Ryan considered hiding the girls. 3 at least could be shrunk out of sight, but what was he to do with the others? And if Ginger was going to barge in at all, she would likely do so quickly. Hiding didn't seem to be an option...

"I'm busy. Don't bother me." Sometimes that worked.

And sometimes it didn't. The door crashes open and Ginger rushed in, as she often did. "Mother said... Who are these little kids?"

It took Ryan a moment to realize Ginger had changed subject in mid-sentence and Mother did not know about his dolls...yet. As he worried about how to keep it that way, he introduced the girls, who responded predictably. "This is Amy,..." who waved to Ginger, "...Berry..." who took a step back from Ginger, who towered over her by a foot, "...Christina..." who responded with "Young lady, just when did you last wash?", "...Dara..." who curtsied "...and Emelia." who clung to Ryan.

"So what are they doing here?"

"Didn't you have a message from Mom?" Ryan dodged. He was likely going to have to answer eventually, but Ginger could lose interest...

"Oh yeah. Ma said she was going shopping and you were to watch me and Doofus."

"You do not refer to your brother as Doofus, even if he deserves it" is Christina's contribution to the conversation.

"Oh yeah? Who are you to tell me that?"

Dara came to Christina's support. "It is an impolite thing to say, and it isn't nice to say something unkind."

Ginger looked ready to argue, but Ryan headed her off for the moment. "OK. Go tell Ma I'll be playing babysitter."

"Right. I'll be back in a minute." With that, Ginger was gone.

Trouble was, she was likely telling the truth. She would be back in a minute, and full of questions he wasn't sure how to answer. And she would likely be bringing Hal, who would ask any questions Ginger missed....
Well, at least he had the minute...
1133121111211112112.title: Ryan tells his sister to stay out

11331211112111121121.content:
But he was still confused when Ginger returned, and was even more so when he saw that she had Hal in tow. "Maw told me to bring him so you won't let him wander off." is her explanation.

Ryan groaned. He should have known. Just because he had gotten bored watching a stupid kid a time or two and not known where he was when she returned, Ma got all unglued and made all these stupid rules about watching him every minute. OK, Hal did like to explore and all, but it's not like he had ever gotten far. But no, she had to stick him with the brat, and because he had forgotten that, now he had another talkative kid who might spill the beans. His secret was rapidly leaking out.

However, that was not the immediate problem. Hal looked at the ladies and asked Ginger "You mean your dumb old secret is just a bunch of stupid girls?"

Christina was the first to react to this "Young man. That is no way to talk about people."

But it is Amy who got into his face. Jumping off the bed, she threatened "You take that back or I'll beat you up."

Hal defied this "I'm not fighting a little girl. That's not allowed." He had a point, or points rather. Hitting a girl wasn't allowed, particularly when he towered well above the shrunk Amy.

Amy considered this for a second and responded with "Well, you can armwrestle me. You apologize if I win."

Hal was not thrilled with the idea, but when Ryan offered to act as judge, he gave in and put up an arm that was much bigger than Amy's.

To everybody's shock, Amy pined him, almost before Ryan had finished saying "three". Hal was howling "You cheated!" almost as fast. Amy's response was a casual "Durn right I did. And you don't have any idea how I did either. So if you want to find out how and make sure nobody else does it, you are going to apologize and promise not to call any of us "stupid". Then this stupid girl will teach you the trick."

Hal looked around, but found no sympathy. So he muttered the common threat "Wait until I tell Mom..."

"You do, and I have something to tell her too." was Ginger's response. Ryan had no idea what she was talking about, but Hal did. Apparently it was something Mom had better not find out about as he gave an half-hearted apology.

"Good enough" was Amy's response. "Now put your hand here and I'll explain what I did..."

As she did, Ryan answered Ginger's persistent questions [honestly since he was also trying to learn whatever trick Amy had used at the same time, and listening to two people at once was hard enough without having to keep your lie straight at the same time.] Ginger's response was happily positive. "That is so cool."

"But we are still trying to decide where everyone is to sleep tonight." Christina points out.

"I know! You can sleep in my doll house!" Ginger suggests. "Really, it's got several beds and lots of room, if you can shrink that is. It'll work great."

"Sleeping with Ginger will be better for Amy and Berry in any case." Dara agrees. [Neither Amy nor Berry seemed convinced that sleeping with Ryan was out of the question.] "And your doll house is a generous offer. May we see this place?"

"Sure. Right this way." Ginger announced, and soon they were on the way to Ginger's room."
11331211112111121121.title: Ginger is helpful

choices: Christina further explores the magic doll house
Berry and Dara start to have second thoughts about moving in
113312111121111211211.content:
Ryan was not sure when was the last time he had been in his sister's room. It could have been a year or more. He was surprised at how girly it was, as well as shocked at the poster of a singer on the wall. The guy was always surrounded by women, and this was one of his more suggestive poses. This shouldn't be on a little girl's wall, particularly not his sister's, and particularly not where she could gaze on him for hours if she wanted to (which it seemed she might). He didn't like it at all [That his own walls would be plastered with naked women if Ma would let him was a completely different case].

However, the center of interest of Ginger's room was not her walls, but her doll house. The girls quickly set to examine it, and Ryan had to admit it was an impressive piece of work. It was four foot tall, and unlike other doll houses he had seen, it was four foot in all dimensions. That made it at least twice the size of any others he had seen. The girls, however, were more interested in the inside.

'...See, I just touch here and it opens right up", Ginger explained to the girls, showing off the inside to approving comments. "And I can touch it here or here to open it to different parts of the house." Again the house opened easily to show different views. The girls moved forward to look closer.

"There sure are lots of bedrooms", noted Dara.

"We'll each have one," commented Berry. "Look, the beds are real cloth. They will be nice and comfortable.." There was a general chorus of "this is perfect"...except from Christina, who was skeptical.

"It is entirely too good", she mumbled to herself, ignoring the surprised reaction of the audience. "How and when did you get this?"

"Mom got this at some second-hand store. She said she got a real good bargain on it. It was...a week ago?"

"So", Christina proclaimed. "A house that will fit us nicely just happens to show up at the same location we just happen to end up at because Ryan made an impulse purchase. And just before we arrive? Does anybody think there might be a problem here?"

"It does sound strange, and a little scary", Emelia admitted as she moved closer to Ryan. Amy, however, was much more optimistic.

"So? It's what we need, and if we are in any danger, this isn't going to change that. Why worry?"

Christina sighed at the girl's response, unable to think of a rebuttal.

"You have a point. But before we fall into this trap, I want to take a closer look. And I don't trust any of you girls to do a good job. Ryan, shrink me to doll house size and then put me into...hmm, that room there looks nice..."

Ryan did as he was told. And a moment later Christina was in her room of choice, the others watching as she looked around.
113312111121111211211.title: The doll house is good. Very good. Maybe too good?

choices: Dara and Berry move right in
Dara and Berry stay 'large' for awhile
1133121111211112112111.content:
Christina took her time examining the room, enough so that Ryan got bored. But she clearly wanted to make a complete inspection and was touching this, opening that, and looking everywhere.

Presently, she opened a door and walked into the hallway. Ginger touched the doll house a couple of times and it opened to show Christina moving to another bedroom to repeat the inspection, this time in less detail. Once again, she left the room for the hallway, but Ginger's moving of the view showed that she was now going downstairs.

Christina ended up in the kitchen, which was again subject to an inspection of some length. Doors were opened and things were moved. It seemed to take a little time to satisfy her.

Finally she turned to her audience and announced in a tiny voice that Ryan had to strain to understand,

"OK, the news is either very good, or very bad. Amy, I suppose you're right. We will have to hope it's very good, because it seems it will be unless until it proves to be bad.
The basic point is that this isn't a doll house. It's a real house down to the finest detail. The beds are real beds, the furniture is real...even the food is real. Another impossibility is that everything works, most obviously the water." [Now that she mentioned it, Ryan did recall her fiddling with several faucets.] That's very convenient, but there'd place for the water to come from, or for it to go. The house is just all house. There's no room for storage tanks or such." [Ryan was wise enough not to mention he didn't think of that.]

"On a more personal level, this is our house. My room contains clothing that fits me, or will if my height is adjusted a bit [Christina had been rummaging around in closets for quite a bit. Ryan had not paid much attention to that.]. More directly, it's clothing I approve of and would want to wear. When I checked another room, the clothing was completely different.

"It's obvious that each room is different. I picked my room because I liked it. Now that I can see it in more detail, I find it more and more what I would've asked for. I suspect the rest of you will find the same thing for some other rooms.

"Bottom line: This place was made for us, and we're going to have to stay here. It just takes care of too many of our practical needs. Somebody went to a lot of trouble to make sure we landed on a cushion, and we would be very rash not to make use of it. We're just going to have to live with the worry that there will be a very high rent on the house.

"Berry, you're going to have to show the rest of us how everything works. I'm not sure if Amy or Dara have ever seen running water, and the technology is enough out of date to give me trouble..but it seems we can move in as soon Ryan shrinks us to the proper size."

Before they could continue, though, Ginger interrupted them.

"Hey, there are more than five bedrooms. What does that mean?"

Christina was not pleased with the interruption, nor with having to admit what was up with that.

"I don't know. It could just be an accident of design, or that the house wasn't sure how many of us there would be, or it could be some of us didn't make it. Ryan, I suppose it would not hurt for you to be on the lookout for other 'special' dolls. Now I have discovered a few aspects of the doll house..."

At this point Christina was mostly taking to air. The other girls have taken the chance to start looking to see what bedroom they would like, and Dara & Berry were debating if they wanted to move in right away. Christina seemed aware of this, and distinctly unhappy with it, but reluctantly accepted.

"Oh very well. I suppose it doesn't make much difference and you will learn it on your own anyway, but..."

Ryan could not hear exactly what she was grumbling, and suspected he didn't want to know.
1133121111211112112111.title: Magic doll house

choices: Ryan and Ginger leave the room, leaving the girls to themselves
11331211112111121121111.content:
"Ooo... Here's a room with several bookcases, and they're full of books. That has got to be mine", Berry announced. There was no objection, nor was there any when Amy claimed a bedroom that seemed to be decorated with animal pictures. Dara and Emelia settled on rooms that were less obviously distinct, but even Ryan could see the rooms were different.

"OK, time to shrink us down and let us move in", Berry announced.

"Not yet", Christina objected. "We need to find out what is our correct size."

"True", Dara agreed. "It would be most annoying to have a closet of lovely clothing, none of which fit."

"Well, I want at those books, and I can still read even if the size is wrong, but I suppose it might save trouble...", was Berry's reluctant agreement.

Measuring just what size was correct took a little work. It wasn't too hard to find that Christina should be a little taller, but exactly how much...? After a little thinking, Christina headed back to her room and selected several garments.

"Now I'll just change into these and we can measure pretty closely." As she headed into the bathroom to change, she paused, and turned to the audience.

"And Ryan, we can see when someone is watching, so don't try it."

"What?" Ryan tried to pretend he hadn't been thinking what Christina knew he had.

"Don't play innocent, young man", an irritated Christina responded. "You were thinking of trying to open the doll house to watch us undress. Besides being in bad taste, you're going to get caught every time. When you look into a room, the wall you look through becomes...well, different, and you can be seen by anyone in the room. So you 're not going to get away with a free peak." With that, she went into the bathroom, and Ryan found himself having to deal with a room of girls giggling at his expense. However, it did occur to him that Christina was the only one of the former dolls who was really indignant at the idea of his looking.

Christina emerged in her new outfit, was measured, and then changed twice more to verify the figures. The final result was not an even figure, in English or Metric, but it was reasonably easy to express, and Dara and Berry were shrunk to a size that still towered over Christina.

Not that there was much chance to measure that. The two girls were off to their rooms almost as soon as they were placed in Christina's, Dara being slightly slower while she made a polite and graceful exit.

That didn't seriously slow Dara down. Had her viewers been interested, they might have wondered how she seemed to be keeping to a stately walk, while covering ground as fast as a run. In any case, neither dignity nor time was lost in getting to her room, and to her clothes closet, and removing a lovely gown. A quick trip behind a screen and she emerged to report that further size adjustments would be necessary, though they were not far off.
11331211112111121121111.title: Dara and Berry move right in

choices: Berry decides to read the books
113312111121111211211111.content:
Berry was just as quick to get to her new room, and to find it nicely satisfactory, though for quite different reasons. Three big floor to ceiling bookcases, just solid with books. There must be...oh, thousands of titles.

Quickly Berry grabbed a book off a shelve. It was a typical romance novel; cheap common trash with a suggestive picture on the cover of a couple, who were not very covered. It was just like she had hoped! She couldn't remember anything of her former life, but she was pretty sure she had thought a day when she didn't devour at least one of these was a day without sunshine. And she had... just oodles of them now, she hoped.

She moved to other shelves and the other cases. More and more romance novels. Were they all romance novels? It was hardly a fate she feared. Still, the steak does taste better with a pinch of salt. Ah, and here was a shelf of salt. She paid little attention to it once finding it. There was likely something she would want there, but the romance novels were what she loved. Now where to start?

Well, since this was all so magical, perhaps these bookcases are magical in some way. Where was the gap where she pulled out this book? Did it refill itself? Or was she just overlooking it? Well, it was easy enough to test. Quickly she pulled out another book, noting carefully where it had been, and what volumes were near it. Then she went to another book case and pulled out a score of books, dumping them all on the bed. Now back to the first book.

No..the gap was still here. Looking to the other case, there was still a large open space, and the books on the bed had not moved. It seemed there was no magic involved, just big old bookcases, which was pretty darn good for Berry. She could just lie there and read for years! Well, she did want to do other things of course, but right now it seemed that the worst that could happen to her would be very good.

Now which one to start with? A bit of a silly question. They were formula books and each was really much the same as the other. Some people consider that a criticism, but they don't love the formula. In any case, Berry couldn't help making a careful decision even tho she knew she would be just as happy with the rejected volume. Finally she selected one and happily threw herself onto the bed, opening to page one before she had stopped bouncing and was deep into the story within a minute. That, of course was when Christina opened the door and came in.

"Time for a tour of the house, and an explanation of how everything is to be operated", she announced. Berry rather desperately peered over the top of her book at this annoucement.

"Can't this wait until tomorrow when all of us are the right size?"

"A tour now will allow us to identify any problems for the tour tomorrow. And unless you want to cook dinner and do the other servant duties, you had best make sure we know how to do them."

Berry sighed. Christina was right as usual, but she so wanted this story right now. Maybe it was worth doing the cooking and cleaning just so she could have it..
113312111121111211211111.title: Berry loves her room

choices: Fast forward to after dinner with Berry and co.
1133121111211112112111112.content:
Berry looked an appeal to Claudia, who glared back.

"But won't this just be duplication? Amy and Emelia won't be with us." Christina, however, was not willing to accept any delay.

"They'll be watching and will learn enough for now", she told the romantic as she pointed to a wall. Berry looked and realized she was correct. The wall was still there and she could see all of it. But she could also see through it to see Ginger's bedroom, and to see Amy and Emelia looking at her. With a sigh that would have been over dramatic for a condemned prisoner on death row, Berry got to her feet and headed out of the room. Dara was waiting on the other side of the door with a polite smile and the end of any hope that Berry could put this off. Well, she would have to do this eventually anyway.

As the tour got underway, Berry found that Christina was right again, thought Christina was not enjoying being right this time [Berry was too kind-hearted to enjoy any of the pratfalls, but Amy, and maybe some of the others, did not hold back laughter].

The main problem seemed to be that she expected the utilities to pretty much run themselves. A faucet was supposed to know not to turn itself on too much, and was supposed to turn itself off. That she didn't understand Berry's instructions added a gallon or two to the resulting disaster. [Berry wasn't sure what Christina was saying as she stood there, a soggy mess, but she was pretty sure that was just as well...] That Christina was sure she knew what she was doing (even when she knew she didn't) made sure the scene was repeated more than once.

Dara was less of an immediate problem, though Berry worried more about the long term. As Christina had suggested, Dara seemed to have no idea how anything worked. That she was too nervous to touch anything at least avoided any immediate problems, but what of the future? Was Christina right in thinking she was some sort of princess who was used to lots of servants? That she lived a life where clothes she dropped on the floor almost picked themselves up? If so, it might be quite a chore getting her to do her share of the chores, to say nothing of well. Still, she seemed a nice girl, and Berry could at least hope things would work out.

The tour ended with the kitchen, and with the realization it was time to prepare dinner. Berry's book would have to wait some more, and that was the good news. Her own ability as cook, she realized, was ...well, what you expect of a girl her age. And her helpers were someone who wouldn't do anything without detailed orders, and someone who wouldn't wait for orders...

The results were not pretty. Berry could only give thanks for food that did not need cooking, and for the microwave [Not that Claudia had not managed to leave a fork in it]. She hoped Amy and Emelia were faring better...
1133121111211112112111112.title: The doll house tour

choices: They fell out of the window!
11331211112111121121111121.content:
As Berry started work on dinner for her crew, Amy watched her, asking her,

"That's a good point. Where do we eat?"

"No problem. I'll just ask Mom if I can have some friends over for dinner", Ginger offered the girls without hesitation. Ryan, however, was more skeptical.

"Ginger, take a look at them. I know Mom and Dad won't look close, but Amy and Emelia don't look like kids."

Ginger looked and realized the problem her brother was talking about. He may be able to shrink a 14-15 year old down to the size of a 4-5 year old, but there were a host of body differences between those ages. Their heads would look tiny, their legs would look too long too long, and their voices would probably sound squeaky as well to those around them.

"Well, maybe they won't pay attention", Ginger hoped, realizing that making the dolls the size of little kids was not the best one.

"Ginger, I don't think they'll notice right away, but we'll be at dinner for a long time. And they just have to notice something once for it to be all up. And then we'll lose our new dolls."

"I guess..."

Ginger had never been one to abandon an idea easily. But a sound of the door opening settled the point.

"Mom's home. We'll sneak you up some food later", she announced to Amy and Emelia, neither of whom seemed distressed.

"No problem. I've missed so many meals that I won't complain of one being late", Amy responded.

"Oh? How many is that?" Dave asked of the girl. Perhaps some of her memory was finally returning? Amy tried to answer, but the answer was the same, typical,

"I have no idea. I suppose it must have been quite a few, but..."

The response was something that Ryan had expected. But right now he had to persuade Mom nothing had happened in her absence, so he and Ginger rushed down to do just that. And of course their behavior roused her suspicions right away. Children do not look innocent when they are innocent; the harder they try to look innocent, the less they are. And when they don't want you to go upstairs, it was definitely time to head upstairs, and to Ginger's room when they almost barred the way. Quickly she opened the door and found ... nothing unusual.

A quick glance at her not-so-innocent children showed they were were also puzzled, but still sure there was something in the room she must not be allowed to find. So a quick declaration that the room was filthy was made [it was of course, by the standards of mothers, if not daughters], and Ginger was made to clean it up, while Mom continued her inspection, looking for the secret, as well as for dirt.

But nothing of note presented itself. Some small secrets Ginger had to be lectured about, but ...say, they were looking at the open window... "casually", she went over and looked around. Nothing. But why did they look this way?

A memory of her own childhood, when she had captured a pigeon and tried to keep it as a pet only to have it fly out an open window, came back to her. That pigeon had made an awful mess before it had escaped. Perhaps this wasn't the exact same thing, but had Ginger been trying to keep some unsuitable pet that thankfully escaped? Perhaps it was time to get Ginger a pet then?

Well that can wait until dinner to discuss. She warned them that it would be ready soon and left the two children relieved but mystified. Where had Amy and Emelia gone to?
11331211112111121121111121.title: Mom's home

choices: Look once again at the instructions
113312111121111211211111211.content:
Ginger and Ryan couldn't resist looking around the room for Amy and Emelia. It was impossible that Mom could have missed them, so they tried the hiding places that just maybe Mom might not have look that closely at. However, it didn't take long to conform the obvious. The girls were gone.

They then asked the other girls in the doll house what happened to them, but they also didn't seem to have any idea of where they went. They had been too busy with dinner, and Ginger had closed the doll house on general principles. It was only when these possibilities had failed that they noticed that Hal wasn't in the room either. Had he taken them to his room? It was worth a check.

And it was a good thing they did, too! The three were in Hal's room, safe and sound. Good news, but Ginger now gave a surprisingly accurate rendition of a lecture she had been on the wrong end of quite a few time.

"You scared us to death running off without letting us knowing..." she lectured her baby brother, much to Ryan's amusement.

"I'm sorry", Emelia replied for Hal. "But it didn't seem safe to stay. I..."

Again she had the look Ryan had seen on all the girls when she tried to remember something from her past. Had she been doing a lot of hiding in her previous life? It seemed possible, but...

"Well, you're right", Ryan acknowledged. "Mom insisted on inspecting Ginger's room for some reason, and I don't want her finding out about you yet. Hal, it's about time for dinner, so we need to get down there. Amy and Emelia, why don't you stay in Ginger's room until we get back with your food?" There were no objections.

Dinner itself was fairly routine, except that with the girls upstairs, nothing was routine. Ryan was all too nervous since he didn't trust his two co-conspirators a bit. Happily the major subject of conversation was the idea of getting Ginger a pet, an idea that puzzled the girl quite a bit. She wasn't against the idea (heck, she approved of it), but this was nowhere near the top of things to bug parents for. Where had this come from, anyway? It didn't really matter to her at the moment, and she had a little time to decide what she wanted.

Even after dinner's end, it was no less stressful a time for Ryan. What would be a good meal for the girls? It had to be something he could smuggle up the stairs as well
It didn't do his heart any good to be caught by Mom as he stared into the fridge. Fortunately, she did not give him much chance to answer her.

"What are you doing?" she asked of her son. Like many teenagers, Ryan had a habit of munchies and she merely launched into the standard lecture about overeating and made no real effort to stop Ryan from escaping with the food. Once back upstairs, he was relieved to have no problems finding Amy and Emelia, who made no complaints about the irregular meal. As they ate, Ryan was able to note some evidence supporting Christina's theory the women had moved through time somehow. Amy didn't seem to have ever seen a fork before. How long ago did forks appear? A thousand years ago?

Well, however long ago, it seemed to confirm that he needed to know more about the mess he was in. But how to get that information?
113312111121111211211111211.title: Hal to the rescue

1133121111211112112111112112.content:
The night passed peacefully...perhaps too peacefully. Something to distract him was sounding rather attractive to Ryan. Like most boys his age, Ryan found the idea of women taking their clothes off a most interesting subject, and right now two attractive lasses were doing just that in his sister's room. He certainly couldn't stay and watch, and thinking of that only made things worse. Could have he suggested one of the girls sleep with him? Amy surely wouldn't object, and Ryan didn't think Emelia would either. In fact, Christina was the only one of the former dolls to not be friendly, and maybe "friendly". It was definitely an interesting question how far their friendship might go.

It also raised a rather scary question. His wildest dreams might be within his reach, and with even the least effort he might put them entirely beyond reach again. But would Amy say "sure", or would she slap his face and never speak to him again? Did he want (really want, that is) to take that risk? Not surprisingly, Ryan did not get the best of sleep that night.

The next day was, thankfully, not a school day, and Ryan could sleep in. When he did get up, it was to find that Amy and Emelia were helping Ginger with her homework. Surprisingly, Ginger seemed rather pleased with this. She might not be the worst at school work, but she shared the normal kid attitude that homework put off might somehow vanish. What was getting her to her books so eagerly (or more precisely, at all)?

A little observation, as he tested and found the instructions were at least partly correct and he can't change the girl's size yet, gave Ryan an idea. Ginger was acting more for a teacher than she was a student. The girls really didn't know a lot of things every child did, and before Ginger could get bored with her homework, Amy or Emelia would ask an obvious question and Ginger would get to show off her superior knowledge. In a minute they would get back to the actual homework and the same process would start again. Maybe Ginger was not learning as fast as she could without the interruptions, but she was learning faster than she would have.

Well, if he couldn't change their sizes and they were busy, it was probably a good time to do his own homework. It went poorly, but Ryan was surprised how much was done by lunch time. Again, his attempt to raid the fridge for the girls was again detected and lectured about. He was sooner or later have to get these girls all out of the doll house. His mother was going to eventually realize that something is up and interrogate him for answers to her questions.

More bad news is that the girls still were still not changing size, though the instructions themselves seemed correct. What was he to do?

"I'm off to the mall. I want to see if that storeowner can tell me what is going on", Ryan announced to the girls, all of whom stopped what they were doing when he told them this.

"Wait!", Berry had to almost shout out to the boy. "Take me with you! The merchant might try to deny things, and if you can show him me he'll have to fess up."

There was something odd about what she was saying, like it was just a reason she had thought of on the spur of the moment. Though Berry had been looking a little frazzled recently. Had she found moving in a little harder than she expected and just wanted a break?

"But how am going to carry you?" Ryan asked of the tiny girl. "My pockets aren't very comfortable, plus you can fall out of them."

"I-in your backpack. I can slip in there with a light and a few books and I'll be fine."

"I dunno. It might be dangerous, Berry..."
1133121111211112112111112112.title: Back to the store

11331211112111121121111121121.content:
"I don't know. As small as you are, it shouldn't take too much to crush you, and stuff can shift around in my backpack pretty easily."

A little testing showed this was a real danger. Ryan suspected the girls were a little tougher than they seemed, but when he tried lowering a book on Berry gently, it was not long before she confessed to distress. It was too easy to guess what would happen if she got between books and his back, and his backpack took a bound like it would any time he tripped or ran or...well, maybe it wouldn't be fatal. Maybe it would only hurt terribly, but maybe... no, he couldn't risk it.

People are often perverse, and the very fact it was impossible made Ryan want to do it. Was there a way to make a safe area for Berry to travel in his backpack? Obviously if he had more time or the right equipment, he could have done so. But what could he do with what he had?

A little cardboard house proved too weak. An iron piggy bank looked really good, until Christina ordered, "Shake it". After the resulting rattle, she added, "Now imagine that was Berry." Again it doesn't take much imagination to imagine what would happen. However, Ryan wasn't ready to give up, and he was working on a way to pack the back with cloth when Christina offered,

"Try the black box that came with us."

It seemed a reasonable thing to try, and so Ryan fetched it. It was a tad small, but not unreasonably so. More important, it didn't bend when he tried to squeeze it, and coins rattled around inside made no noise. Now Berry was allowed to climb in for a gentle shake. When she reported no motion at all, the shakes became more vigorous, but without disturbing Berry in the slightest.

"Totally impossible," Christina commented, "But it suits our needs."

Indeed so. It still took a few minutes to rig up a light to read by, and for Berry to climb in with several books she can read, but the box was soon enough stashed in his backpack and Ryan could wish the others a good day.

Getting out of the house was not so easy. Based on plenty of experience, his mother did not find his story of having his homework practically done believable (practically started, maybe). There was then another lecture on getting things done to endure. But in the end, Berry was not noticed, and Ryan was allowed to escape.

So now it was off to Mr. Johnson's Shop of Strange and Wonderful Things. It wasn't a short walk, but it was on the second shortest (and arguably the most interesting) route to school, and one did not have to walk to school if the distance was major. Ryan had been there dozens of times, so there was no reason this trip should be much different.
11331211112111121121111121121.title: Taking Berry along

choices: Pulled from various times/places, then frozen, shrunk, and sold as collectibles
113312111121111211211111211211.content:
After finally making it to the shop, Ryan was surprised to find it gone! And not even replaced by another store: it was simply replaced by a blank wall and nothing more. Ryan looked very frustrated by this recent turn of events, pulling out his black box and opening it up to tell Berry.

She was as shocked as she was. Without the owner's guidance, there was no way of Ryan to tell what to do next. Depressed and frustrated by the recent turn of events, the two unhappily decided to go home.

"Christina and the others aren't going to be happy about this", Ryan and Berry said at the sad time, both in a sad, pathetic tone of voice.

Another half hour passed by the time Ryan finally came home. The other dolls heard his footsteps as he closed the front door and proceeded to climb the stairs, happy to see him and of any news he might have for them, only to be meant with a sad, gloomy disposition on the boy's face instead.

"Let me guess. Nothing?" Christina asked him. Ryan sadly shook his head up and down in reply, placing Berry gently on the ground while doing so.

"Please don't be mad at Ryan. It's not his fault...", Berry defended him.

Ryan decided to then try something he should have done a long time ago: try to find information on the Internet. He pulled out the laptop from under his bed, turned it on, and started surfing the Internet, hoping to find any information at all about the dolls, the black box, or the shop he bought them from. Surprisingly his searching came up with results! It seems that the five figurines with Ryan were actually...
113312111121111211211111211211.title: The vanishing shop brings up answers??

1133121111211112112111112112112.content:
The internet is wonderful in providing information on any subject. It is much less wonderful in providing only the relavant information. A ton of information, and you only want an ounce of it. It's quite an improvement over simply not having the desired information, but it can be a very annoying chore to dig out the tiny bit you need.

So Ryan found himself downright stunned to be looking at pictures of all five girls almost immediately. There was no question. It was all five, and they were labeled "Recent Rescues", whatever that meant. Once Ryan got over his shock, he started looking over the site.

"It's weird. We have a site called Damsels in Distress, but it doesn't appear when I Google it. Just when I look for something else entirely..." he told the watching girls, "But it's definitely you. Clothing and all.
"They say you were each in some situation of dire peril and somehow they were able to offer you a chance to escape. They don't really say how, or what the danger was."

"They don't really say there was a real danger at all." Christina broke in. "Oh, they use the words, but they offer no actual proof. For all we know, we are just random kidnappings whose memories have been eliminated."

"You think so?" Ryan asked.

"I don't know." Christina conceded. "I do know it would be a lot more profitable to not have to bother finding girls who actually want to escape something. However, I do notice a few things that at least offer hope, tho I'm not sure having been in terrible danger is something I should hope for.
"You see all those appeals for funds. That is at least consistent with this being some sort of charity. Of course a lot of charities are con games, but kidnapping women to claim they rescued them sounds extreme even by those standards.
"Then there is myself, and perhaps Dara. Anything like this should be exposed fairly rapidly. Say it is discovered how to do this ten years from now. Twenty years from now, it would be well known, and thiry, every woman would be protected from it. But I may be from fifty years from now. This just should not work on me.
"Now maybe it's from a hundred years in the future. But now what is there now that will be worth a fortune a hundred years from now? Most of the things I can think of do not require kidnapping a number of women.
"Then there is Dara. She may not have any so-called magic that will come looking for her, but she comes from very far away, impossibly far, you might say. It would seem a lot of unnecessary expense if someone was just grabbing girls at random.
"Of course, I'm really just guessing. Maybe it's like a window opening and they just have to take what they can get. But my guess is that they are not that depraved anyway."

But Christina realized that she had gone too deep into lecture mode and had lost much of her audience. Amy was asking "Berry, what is in that book you keep on taking peeks at?"

Berry quickly confirmed it was something interesting by hiding the book behind her and saying in a most unconvincing tone "Oh, nothing, nothing important."

In the meantime, Ryan's attention had been drawn to a part of the screen that suggested he could order the girls to do whatever he wanted.
1133121111211112112111112112112.title: Pulled from various times/places, then frozen, ...

11331211112111121121111121121122.content:
Fortunately Christina was watching Ryan and noticed his eyes had strayed to a section that suggested the girls would obey any orders he gave. Not taking the time to be sure of the wording, Christina warned "You had better not be getting any improper ideas."

"But it says you will do what I want..." Ryan defended himself.

"If you try ordering me to do something perverted, I ..." Christina stopped. What would she refuse to do? There ought to be a very long list, some of them way too obvious, but what are they? Well, she didn't dare pause and think here, so she tried a diversion "...suggest you think of your sister."

"What does she have to do with this?"

"She will be seeing everything you do with us. You can't keep her from barging in and seeing. You know that.
