"I can't promise anything, and it'll be a couple of days anyway", Iris told Ryan.

"Well, I wouldn't be surprised if it is a week before they should be out in public anyway. They do have a lot to learn", e responded, thinking of the various things that would happen should the girls interact with the real world.

Soon enough they were in sight of Ryan's house, and Iris ducked back into the backpack. Then she learned that climbing stairs in that backpack was an "experience". Of course, Ryan's willingness to take two steps at a time did add a little excitement. Thankfully, it also made it shorter.

Iris then found herself in Ginger's room,which she gazed at, looking like a mansion from her height. It was certainly not like any dollhouse she has ever seen, nor did it seem like one as she entered. It looked amazing, like a full size house. There was something odd at the walls, though..

"You can see through the walls", Amy explained. "Ryan and Ginger can open the house up to look inside. When they do, you can see them just they can see you." This was immediately confirmed when Ryan opened the room up and Iris found herself seeing both the wall and Ryan beyond it.

"I see..." Iris responded, unsure if she approved of that kind of opening or not. "Perhaps I should meet the other girls..."

That was quickly arranged. Emelia seemed quite nice. Dara was in some ways nicer, but Iris wasn't sure what she felt about that story of her not being human. Christina reminded her of her older sister, which was not in her favor. And like her older sister, Christina seemed to want to push her around.

"You want to enroll us in school? Then perhaps you should tell us about it."

Iris was tempted to refuse just to annoy her "older sister", but it was her idea, and so she did need to teach these girls what she could...unless she got a better idea.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Starting to make plans

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
Iris described her normal school day to the other girls. She told them about she went to a place with a couple thousand students, all of them of about her age, where she moved to several different classrooms for each class during the course of her day, and that she would be doing this for 3 more years. She was surprised at how abnormal this seemed to most of her audience. Christina's idea that the girls came from very different backgrounds was sounding more and more reasonable.

The girls insisted they remembered nothing, but there were hints. Berry seemed to regard this school idea as reasonably normal, but Amy didn't even know what a school was: she didn't seem to have never had any form of formal instruction. Emelia knew what a school was, but that one would go there for a dozen years and for all year long? This sounded absurd to her. Dara found it reasonable that she would be going to school so much, but she seemed to think school should be one student to one teacher. Iris was not so sure she understood what Christina was saying. Was she saying she had never physically been in the same room with a teacher or other classmates? Did she communicate with them entirely by computer? Even if she was from the future like she thought, that seemed hard to believe (Then again, Christina complained about books lacking search functions. That was very sci--fi from Iris' view, but Christina deemed it very normal and basic. So maybe..).

However, Christina did not like not being in charge of the situation, and so she took another glance at Iris before telling her,

"So we should be going to school as soon as you can get us ready. So how are we to do that?"

"Well, Ryan has this idea of sneaking you into the school, but it would likely be better to talk with the principal instead", Iris started.

"No", went Christina, unpleasant by Iris' suggestion.

"No?"

"No. I'm not sure what your authorities will do, but I know bad things will happen. We many never even see Ryan again. We owe him a lot for saving us, and are eager to repay him anyway we can, if not in the way he likely wants (well, I won't repay him that way at least). But if Ryan wants us to stay here, we'll do so happily. So we need to find a way to sneak into your school if we're going to go to it". Christina's attitude showed her determination in the situation. Looking at the others, Iris saw no disagreement.

"She's right", Berry agreed. "I can just imagine the police thinking we have broken some law or other, or some scientists insisting we need to go be studied, or...". She could've gone on for a while if needed, but what she had already said was enough to scare Emelia into tears, and the others broke off to assure her it wasn't that bad.

Iris could see she was not going to convince them they were wrong, and they could be right. There were all sorts of laws they could be violating, but if they could convince anybody to listen, they would also cause all sorts of fuss. Things might be settled well enough, but there was no guarantee.

"Well, I do have a friend who might be able to sneak most of you into school. If that's what you really want.."

They do, and Iris was left to wonder how she can manage that.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Describing school, and...

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
There was a full doll house for Iris to explore, which was a rather ordinary place..as long as one forgot it was a doll house. Of course, it was very large, several times the size of her home (or most homes she had been in), but if one thought of it as an apartment building, it was common enough, mostly. But then one remembered it was a doll house in a little girl's bedroom, and all sorts of impossibilities became apparent. They would be quite disturbing if they didn't make life so much more convenient.

However, Iris was relieved when she noticed Ryan was once again looking in.

"OK, it's time for me to go home. If you could take me out and grow me...", requested Iris, reaching out her hands to the boy.

"Well, it wouldn't be a good idea to return you to normal size while you're still inside of the doll house. Now how to do that? Oh, just get into that basket there."

Once Iris had done as told, he continued,

"Now just be calm..." And with that he put the basket out the window and started lowering it calmly. Calm was definitely what he wanted. That would be much easier to maintain if one were not in a shaky basket that jerked every time Ryan fed out another foot of the rope. Granted it was a good idea, but it was so easy to think about how easy the basket could jerk enough to flip her out.

But then she felt a bump that meant she was on the ground, and she could wait until Ryan slipped out of the house and picked up the basket and herself. Ryan happily carried the basket with less jerking than when he lowered it. And it was hardly any time at all before Ryan was saying to Iris,

"OK, this is out of anybody's sight..."

And a moment later, Iris was back to normal as Ryan talked into the black box and returned the girl back to her original size.

"Quite a day", Iris sighed. "Thanks, Ryan. I think I may want to visit 'your' girls again. I'll be seeing you, then." And with that, Iris headed home.

But should she head directly home? She wondered if this was the best time to have a talk with John, if she was going to at all. She was thinking of asking him quite a favor, after all. He might well refuse, or he might agree, and that could be worse. She didn't think he would go all crude on her. He was too nice a guy for that. Of course, that would be worse in a way as well. She of course would refuse if he demanded some sort of "pay", but if he just says he will be glad to just do her a favor. Well, favors need to be repaid.

He wouldn't want that as a repayment, would he? Well of course he would, but...he wouldn't ask, would he?

To make it worse, she wasn't sure how she would respond. John was...well, very nice. It was kinda early to be thinking much, but things could get pretty serious. Did she want them to? It could be really wonderful...or not. Was she ready to find out?

This favor could easily end up in her rushing into things. It was all so scary, but Iris could think of no other way to get the girls into the school without John's help. Maybe he could think of something that won't commit her quite so much.

Well, she would find out soon enough. Somehow her feet carried herself to John's home.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Taking Iris' lead

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
This might be her last chance to chicken out. She could still just turn around and go home. And that might be the most sensible thing she had ever done in her life.
Or it might be passing up something wonderful... Or it might be nothing at all. After all, a lot of important decisions didn't seem to have made much difference... But she was really afraid this wasn't one of them.
Oh why dither? She had made her decision an hour ago, and despite all her scardy cat feelings, she wasn't going to change it. She'd just have to hope it worked out. With that, she rang the bell.

John was quick to answer, and thankfully happier to see her than she was that he was home. After a few casual remarks and being invited in, Iris got down to business. "John, I'm wanting to see if you will do me a big favor..."

"Of course. What is it?"

"Well, you've bragged you can do just about anything with the school records..."

"This about your grades? I thought you were doing pretty well in your classes?"

"No. It's nothing about me. It's ... Well, just hear me out before you say I'm crazy."

"Just as well it's not about fixing your grades. I can do that, but it's probably a bad idea. Too many people would know too much. And you should be studying, even if the work is stupid and boring. But let's hear your story..."

It took Iris far longer to tell her story than she would have expected. Part of the problem was she hadn't realized just how much she had just assumed without checking, not to mention how much just sounded silly, at least until you had actually seen a girl grown and had been shrunk herself as well.
At least John didn't laugh. She didn't think he was taking the idea seriously, for which she could hardly blame him, but at least he was pretending to. "Now I have just got to see these girls. That's a sight not to be missed. That's first.
"Second, I have to point out you are risking a lot of trouble here. There have got to be lots of better ways to deal with this than just sneaking around like this."

"I know, but the girls aren't interested in anything that parts them from Ryan, and they may be right that official attention could turn nasty."

"I suppose." John agrees. "The government can do some pretty nasty things by accident, and even worse on purpose. We'll [a word that Iris found very encouraging] still have to talk with them some more about just coming clean.
"Now I should be able to fake the needed records. Nobody really pays that much attention to them when you come down to it. But we will need to make sure the girls keep their heads down. Too much notice and somebody will ask the wrong questions. We don't want that."

"But you'll help?" She might someday might bitterly regret that, but right now it seemed so thrilling...

"Anything for you, my girl. Now first..."
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: John is eager to help

choices: The girls prepare for the picnic tomorrow
Some of the girls have their doubts about the picnic..
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
"I do need to meet these ex-dolls. If nothing else, the records will require a description of them. And I'm sure they will be quite interesting. So how do we get together with them? We do want a fair amount of privacy, which rules out most restaurants, and I'm sure I can explain going to Ryan's house."

"How about a picnic?" John suggested. "The park isn't too busy; we wouldn't be noticed there."

"That sounds good to me", Iris responded. Though John left unmentioned was that this will be a "date" that wouldn't really be a date. She wasn't sure if John was quite scary or quite attractive [or both?]. A safe(?) way of finding out sounded like a good idea.

"I'll need to check with Ryan, of course", Iris added. With that, she pulled out her cell-phone and called up Ryan, who quickly answered.

“Hi. How alone are you?” she asked him. As with the many attempts to be secret, Iris trying to sneak around was more noticeable than if she didn’t try. But she didn’t want to be spilling secrets where his parents could hear, and so forgot that she was revealing there were secrets worth hearing. But this time, she was lucky.

“I’m in my room. What’s up?”

“We were thinking of a picnic with you and the girls tomorrow at the park. That work with you?”

“Ah…yeah, it would. Let me check first, though. I’ll call you back", Ryan ended the call with, running down the stairs and asking his mother if he could go to the park tomorrow with Iris and a "couple of other kids". His mother could be forgiven for focusing on the mention of Iris, and assuming that was the important part. She thought it was about time for Ryan to wanting to be alone with young ladies, and Iris seemed a nice enough one. And since they weren't going to be too alone, she told him it was okay almost without thinking. Though perhaps she should have paid more attention to Ryan going back upstairs to phone Iris instead of using the home phone right at his fingertips. Still, teenagers do value their privacy, and she found nothing unusual about it.

In the meantime Ryan phoned Iris to tell her going to the picnic tomorrow was ready to go, and then he went to Ginger's room to tell the girls they now had a social life of sorts. The announcement did not go off quite as smoothly as he might have expected...
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Destination: Picinic

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
In part from being male, and in part from being young, Ryan assumed his share of any duties about the picnic consisted of telling the girls about it, and showing up. As any girl might have told him, that was a rather biased view. Not entire inaccurate, but still biased.
However, this time those duties were a little more extensive than he had assumed. Neither Amy nor Christina seemed to know what a picnic was And when this was explained to them it was Dara's turn to object.

"But where are the guards?"

"Guards?"

"Yes, I would think a dozen or more, and we would need weapons too." Dara continued.

"Oh for Heaven's sake." Berry objected. "Do you really think we are going be attacked by some monster when we are on a picnic?"

"Not if we are ready for it." is her matter of fact reply.

"I'm surprised you didn't call for a dozen servants too." Christina interjected.

"Well, I would, but we seem to be doing without for some reason." Dara casually answered. This was already an old story for the other girls. Dara would politely do any chore asked of her, but she still acted surprised if a dress she dropped on the floor was still there the next time she entered the room.

"Dara," Berry assured her, "I don't know how it was where you came from... I guess you don't either..., but we don't need the guards here. This is perfectly safe. There won't be any monsters or any danger." Dara did not look convinced, but as all knew, she almost never contradicted anyone.

"Anyway," Berry continued, "We need to prepare our food for the picnic...and we will be normal size, won't we? Well, everything we have carried up to now has shrunk or grown with us, so maybe no problem, but we had best check..."

A moment later Berry was loaded down with whatever was within reach. "Now grow me." Ryan did as requested and shortly Berry was much larger, but still loaded down. "Great. We can grow the food we have in the house and take it along. Now just shrink me back down and we can start preparing for the picnic."

A minute later, the girls were busy with that, and Ryan was left free to plan out how to get them out of the house and to the picnic. Not a really tough task, but not one to be ignored.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: The girls prepare for the picnic tomorrow

choices: John presents the girls with some paperwork
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
Getting the girls safely out of the house proved simpler than Ryan had thought. Of course, he was not going to admit to anyone just how long it took him to think of the idea. It looked entirely too obvious once he had gotten past the agonizing. Happily the girls didn't seem to know what his idea was. Of course, they apparently had not worried about it either. But the idea they had expected him to find a solution for wasn't exactly hard on his ego.

Once the girls were assembled in the doll house kitchen and had the food ready, Ryan opened the doll house to the kitchen and announced information for them.

"OK Amy, step into our magic box, and", he told Amy as she did as told. "Amy, 1 inch."

And now there was still plenty of room for the other girls too. Shortly he had all the other lasses in the box, which was still not at all full. And yet, somehow, its contents would not be affected by outside movements. Suppressing a sudden desire to give that a real testing, Ryan now put the box, and the girls, into his backpack. Excellent. His mother wouldn't ever look in there, and would not worry about a small box if she did. He then went downstairs to pick up the lunch his mom was making.

All went as expected, and Ryan was soon walking to the park, wishing he was just a little older and had his own car. But he wasn't, and he couldn't have his mother drive him, not when he was deep in his secret magic, so he had to walk to the park. But at least he was young and healthy.

Soon enough he was entering the park. Finding Iris and John, if not as easy as it was supposed to be, was only a minor task. John directed them to an area pretty much out of sight where a blanket was spread.

"Now", John demanded. "You are supposed to have some young ladies with you. Where are they?"

As a showman, Ryan needed quite a bit of training. Turning a tiny 1' girl into a normal one of 5'6" or so ought to be dramatic. But somehow Ryan found a way not to shock his audience (well, not any more than seeing the impossible happen several times would impress anybody). A moment later, a picnic of 3 became a picnic of 8, and the food available crowded the blanket as the girls distributed their burdens. Happily for Ryan's ego, John proved easy to impress and was still standing there with his mouth open after the girls had introduced themselves and had a seat.

"I...see", he finally uttered after wearing off the shocking sight before him. Before he say anymore, though, Ryan's appetite prevented him from doing so.

"OK, everyone. Let's eat!", he announced, which everyone agreed with. Everyone was in a much better mood after eating their food.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Off to the picnic

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
"OK, down to work", John announced. "Now I need your vital statistics. Name, age, height, weight..., just fill out this form here." With that, John passed out clip boards with paper and pencils, and the girls set to work filling them out. A bit surprisingly.

Ryan was fairly sure that Amy had been completely illiterate in her old life, and he wouldn't bet against Emelia being unable to write. But somehow they were able to handle the form reasonably, or at least as well as the others...which wasn't all that well. The first line brought trouble; none of the girls knew their last names (though Ryan suspected that Amy had never had one). And many other lines were also problems. Their discussion on how to deal with this was why they were surprised to hear from John, "Bet you girls would like to meet some real men."

Turning, Ryan found himself facing some of the reasons a private location in a public park could be a bad idea. Five punks had somehow crept up on them. The smallest of them outweighed Ryan by 20 pounds, all of that muscle, and the biggest was larger than John by at least that much. And they were likely armed and used to fighting, too. Worse, they were likely eager to. This was not the time to remember how happy he had been that nobody like the police would notice them here...

This was really not the time to be a male. A man must stand between women and the threat, and get beat to a pulp while the women escaped. Couldn't he please still be a little boy? But Ryan still found himself struggling to his feet, and trying to get into position. But somehow Dara was there first.

"We thank you for the offer, but we are satisfied with our current escorts. Now we have personal business, so I must request you leave", she politely told them, hoping they would listen. The nearest lout laughed and grabbed her arm, pulling her to him.

"I'll take a kiss first", he told Dara as he pushed her face closer to his.

"I must warn you to let go of me..."

Amused, the big thug asked the delicate lass a full foot shorter than him, "And what will you do when I don't?"

A second later he was on the ground, howling in pain. A kick to the head silenced that.

"That", was Dara's serene answer, but Ryan was anything but serene. Those other four lowlifes before might've been satisfied to just beat him up, but now they were out for blood, with his{/i} blood being all too high on that list. But he couldn't let Dara get hurt, even if the only way to stop this was really going to hurt (if he was lucky). He took a step forward...

Dara, however, took two. What else she did was impossible for Ryan to see. But the thug pulling his knife had dropped it as he held his now limp arm. His pal next to him was crumbling to the ground, clearly out of the fight. Two steps behind them, the last two stopped advancing, looked at their fallen companions, and proceeded to take a step back.

As Ryan tried to gather his wits, Dara turned to him and casually said,

"This is why I wanted guards; they could've taken charge of such trifles. So what is to be done with them?"

"Ah... We don't want attention. Best if they just leave", Ryan decided.

"Very well", Dara complied, turning her face to the remaining louts. "If you would please remove your companions, I would be most grateful." She took a few steps back so they could do so.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Unwanted company

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
Dara turned to face John "I apologize for any upset I may have caused. I hope this will not cause you any trouble."

Turning one's back on dangerous thugs is rash, and one of the punks proceeded to show why. A knife was suddenly in his hand and he threw it at Dara's exposed back. Ryan saw it, but had barely opened his mouth to shout a warning before the knife reached her...
And missed. Somehow Dara had turned just enough that the knife aimed for the middle of her back went speeding by her, heading right at a shocked John who was definitely not going to be able to dodge...
But it seemed that Dara could pluck the knife right out of the air, even if the force behind it spun her around. Or did she just use the energy of the throw to spin herself around? In either case, she ended up facing a startled foe who had not yet even realized he might be the one in peril.

"A very nice knife. I thank you for the peace gift and accept it as a worthy pledge that all disputes between us are as nothing. I grant you leave to depart without pursuit. Should we meet again, all is well between us."

The former owner of the knife looked at it, and then at his damaged companions, and decided enough was enough. He turned to the last lout and after a gesture, the two began helping their friends leave.

Most of the picnickers remained in a state of shock until they were out of sight. Dara was inspecting the knife. "Better quality than I had thought. "I hope they didn't steal it."

Ryan managed to get his voice back. "How could you do that? There were five of them, big mean guys..."

"How could I not? They were just 1st level commoners. It wasn't even a level-appropriate encounter."

"1st level? Encounter?" John asked. "That's gamer talk. Where did you hear that?"

"I'm sorry, but I have no idea. Those simply seemed the proper words. I do not know why." Dara answered.

Christina broke her own silence with "It may be we have underestimated how different Dara's background is. However, I suggest we consider it later. We have business to take care of.

"Ah..yes." John agreed. "Now I still need all the information I can get from you five. I can see I hadn't realized all we would need, but we can make a start and we can get together later to take care of the rest."

The girls got to work, but it was hard not to think about what they had just seen, and to wonder if there were more secrets about Dara, or about themselves for that matter.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: They need another lesson

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
"Now I figured to make you all foreign exchange students." John muttered, looking at the large blank areas in the forms the girls had filled out. "That would cover a lot of ignorance on your parts. But I hadn't realized you don't even know much about yourselves. You are walking time bombs. Any one of you may have some talent you won't know anything about until something triggers it. And that trigger could blow your cover to pieces..."

"Then we shall have to exercise care and preparation, shall we not?" "asked" Christina. "Do you have any plans for discovering any of our 'secrets'?"

"Maybe... Catch!" and John tossed a baseball at Christina, who fumbled it badly. "Now if you will toss it back..." A furious Christina tried to throw it directly and hard at him, but John had to dive to catch the wild miss, which had fortunately not been thrown nearly as hard as its thrower had wanted. [Ryan was rather envious that John had managed to one hand the catch.]
"Now the rest of you..."

The test turned up no talent or knowledge of baseball. Amy showed a good
deal of enthusiasm and may well have thrown something in her past, but it had not been a baseball [rocks maybe?]. But even Dara who had been so casually skilled with a knife, threw the baseball...well like a girl.

"Bad news and good." John muttered. "It seems you need a very precise trigger, which means we will have a terrible time finding it, but that probably also means there isn't that much danger you will do something that attracts attention.
"We'll still have to do a lot more tests. But we should be able to figure out some skills you can more or less fake or learn, and some stuff you will like doing."

"We will do what we can to make your job easier." Christina announced, which earned a smile from John, and a frown from Iris. John scares her, and he may just ruin her life in the near future, but she is not about to let Christina steal him from her.

Of course, she is not at all sure she intends to steal John, and even less sure how she is to prevent it. At most ages, the younger woman has the advantage, but at her age, Christina makes Iris feel like a baby. John is not going to be doing what Iris doesn't want him doing while Christina is around... at least not unless Iris does something...
But what?...
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Working on the paperwork

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
"I can help you with the paperwork," Iris announced.

Now why had she volunteered like that? She would be alone with John entirely too much for comfort. What if he tried something? Could she trust him? Would he...? What if he...? Of course he wouldn't do that sort of that thing. But what about...? For that matter, could she trust herself? John was a quite attractive fellow, after all. Would she really resist his masculine charms? Or would she do something totally humiliating? She supposed she could convince everybody it was John's fault (everybody but herself anyway). And what if her friends, or her family, heard about how much time she would be spending alone with him? What would they say? What would they do? Could she live with that?

Wouldn't it be better, and/or safer to just keep her distance, to let him work alone...alone with Christina...?

Not really a difficult decision, was it...No it wasn't. If John was just going to absolutely ruin the life of some girl, it was going to be her. But that didn't stop her from worries when John then said something to her.

"Excellent. There is a lot of work and I will need the help."

Iris found herself with an armful of paper and a pen shoved in her arms, and a quickly suppressed feeling that she would have preferred it if he had done something ungentlemanly. But John was asking the girls questions and she had to record the answers.

Her feeling of doing some almost made the work vanished as she looked over the questions: the list had obviously been written by a male. Several important questions (important to any woman at least) were absent. Of course the girls didn't know their mother's names, but that didn't mean they shouldn't have been on the form. She didn't feel really proud about pointing this out, but her feeling of being rather worthless did vanish.

"That'l do for today", john announced after the girls filled out the forms. "I have lists for you to fill out and memorize, starting with your last names. You just fill in what seems reasonable. But it needs to be something you can remember. Nobody will notice whether your absent mother is Ann Jones or Betty Smith, but they will notice if you use both names. So the important thing is that you know everything on the list and respond automatically with that answer. Give me a call and tell me what's on the lists. I should have preliminary paperwork the next time we get together." After farewells were between John, Ryan, and the girls, the guy had one more thing left to do. And it had to do with Iris.

"If you can come with me, Iris, we can get some work done."

"Sure", she hesitated to rely, a catch in her voice.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Iris the assistant worker

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
It would be worse, a lot worse, if he had just grabbed her as soon as they were alone and done some horrible things to her before kicking her onto the street. But at least then her mother would be kissing away her tears, and everybody would be all sympathetic, and she wouldn't have to be doing all this stupid paperwork, which her mother would probably say was good for her.
Well, that might fit. Certainly it "tasted" like medicine that was good for you. And Iris was all so eager to "spit it out". More realistically, take her hours of work, burn them to ashes, and dance on those ashes. And like with medicine, she knew that was a very bad idea. With a sigh, she got back to work.
It would help if she knew John's intentions... Well, she did actually. He's a boy after all, so that was given. But how honorable were those intentions? There was a big difference between his pleading for permission and dragging her into a back room and throwing her on a bed.
...For that matter there was a big difference between his dragging her into a back room and throwing her on a bed and his dragging her into a back room and throwing her on a bed. She wasn't sure she could say why or how, but when she pictured such a scene, it didn't always seem horrible, not at all.
Maybe it was that there was no more doubt. Certainly it was bad enough not knowing what he was going to do, and not knowing what she wanted him to do.
In that respect, John was being no help at all. OK, she didn't want him trying to paw her or something, and she wasn't at all sure she wanted him writing sonnets about her. But she wasn't all that thrilled by his being a gentleman with intentions either.

Nor was she sure how to handle things when John finally announced "That's about all we can do for now. Let's get some supper."

"Ah...my parents will be expecting me..."

"Give them a call."

Declining was not an option and thankfully her parents made no problems. Standing here and lying to her parents when John could hear, or telling the truth, they both sounded bad. Much better that she was merely given a time to be home by. [Or was that bad too? John would know if she tried to use her parents as an excuse in the future... Well, that is the future, and at least she was getting by today.]

Dinner did nothing to relieve her anxieties. Well, maybe technically. The dinner was nice, and she had a good time and all, which John went out of his way to make sure of. But that just meant she was a step closer to being completely at his mercy, and she still had no idea if that was a good or bad thing.
She would be much happier, at least for now, if she could only live for the moment, but...
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Clerical work is dull

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
Ryan was finding that he had too much of a good thing. If he had stopped with just taking Amy from the box, he would be learning a lot about anatomy by now. He can only guess just how much, but Amy was uninhibited and liked him. The idea of how much she would be willing to do was quite disturbing, and even more interesting.
If he had just taken out Emelia, she just clung to him as a protector. Surely she would have been willing to reward him for a job well done. Of course he did have thoughts at times that this would have been taking advantage of her, but he doubted Emelia would see it that way, at least if he did that job of protector.
Berry too wouldn't see it as anything but wonderful if he honestly swore he loved her. Maybe he couldn't do that right away, but if he and she had been alone...
It was a little harder to see Dara throwing herself at him. She was always so correct. Still, she did like him and even if Ryan couldn't figure out how he could persuade her, he could see a picture them both in bed without thinking that was impossible.
Which was what he thought in the case of Cristina. She too liked him, but all too much in a big sisterly way. Not much chance even if they had been alone from the start.
And there was even less chance having all five of them. Amy on his left entirely too close for comfort, and Emelia even closer on the right, how did one court Berry across the table? Dara might not be much of a wet blanket, but Christina sure was. Ryan might be touching more female flesh that he would have though just a little while ago, but that was all he was doing, and there was little hope he would be doing more.
Given his experience, he wondered if those kings with big harems ever got any at all.

Instead, his time with the girls was spent getting them ready for school. There was so much that they didn't know, things which they would be assumed to know. Even Berry didn't know obvious things like who was President. More important, people would be asking about their family and background, things they could only guess about. They must invent histories and families, and be drilled in the details.
Which meant that Ryan, surrounded by boobs and having them right in front of him, has to ignore them and listen to what the girls were saying The obviously important question of whether Amy was wearing a bra must take second place to whether she was reciting the names of her non-existent family correctly. There seemed to be a relationship between how much emotion Berry uses in her statement and how much her breasts bounce, but of course Ryan can't look at her rack enough to be sure. And Emelia was so apt to lean forward to ask if her answer was correct... The work was harder for Ryan than for the girls.

Still, the work was getting done. Soon the girls would be ready for school, if Ryan could last that long.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Ryan could do with less

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
It seemed to take forever, and it seemed that the time just flew by. But it was just over a week before Berry became the the test case. She was the one who knew current conditions. Even if she didn't know a lot of things she should have, she knew a lot the rest still had to learn.

The day started with a nervous breakfast. "But why do we need to go to school?" Emelia asked for the thousandth time.

"Kids our age go to school." Berry responded.

"And nice as this doll house is, we don't want to spend our lives here." Christina ruled.

"You're the one who is too old to go to school." Amy charged.

"No, I am the one it is harder to fake records for." Christina defended herself. "You will be going to a school where John can create fake records for you. He doesn't have the means to do the same for me. So we need to work in more devious, and slower, means."

"But.." Amy started to respond.

"Excuse me, but Ryan wants this," Dara put in, "and we owe him too much not to do as he wishes." It was a crushing point. They might not know why they owed Ryan and they were not sure how much either, but they were sure they owed him a lot, and were eager to repay that debt.

Christina added "And that means we must do it well. We are taking a risk, and can not afford to be sloppy. We do not know what would happen if we were discovered, but we are sure we don't want it to happen."

The doubts were not resolved. They were all trying something new and that was scary, even for Berry who likely faced only a different set of names from what her unknown past school was like. Her almost memory would carry her thru many a crisis. But the others faced a very new future and that meant a lot of worries.
But they were going to face them. That was decided. The only choice was how well, and they hoped to face them well. School, it would be.
But it still made for a grim breakfast.

Presently, it was time. Berry exited the doll house with a number of hugs and hopes for good luck, and got into Ryan's backpack. There she stayed during the ride to school. Once there, Ryan found a hidden spot, and then Berry was 5'4" and ready [?] for school.

"The administration building is right over there." Ryan directed her. "Good luck."

Berry thanked him and headed that way, getting the comfort of seeing an administration building that looked familiar even tho she had never seen it before. She opened the door and plunged into her new future.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Berry is ready, maybe

choices: Berry tries to meet new people
There seemed to be a stowaway in Berry's school bag..
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
The school office was "familiar" to Berry. That she had no memory of ever being in one didn't stop her from knowing that this woman here was the receptionist and who Berry should report to. Knowing how she would be treated was unfortunately another matter. Happily the woman was friendly.

"Yes? Can I help you?" she asked Berry, who handed over the faked paperwork, which is casually scanned.

"I see. It will take me a little time to process this. In the meantime, you should see the principal."

The words may have been said in a friendly manner, but they still sounded like the clap of doom to Berry. But there was no choice but to follow directions to the dreaded door.

For good or ill, Berry had time to wonder why she was so terrified. She had done nothing wrong (at least that anybody here knows about). Why fear him? Had she been dragged before a previous principal for frequent punishment? Or maybe the opposite? Had she never been in trouble and thus this was just the fear of the unknown? Well, in either case, it was of the past and completely gone from her life. She knocked and entered on command.

Here too, she found her fears were unfounded. The principal welcomed her and asked a few routine questions, not questioning her memorized responses. He spoke some likely formulaic statements that he expected her to do well here and then allowed her to leave as he turned to other work. He was nothing like the ogre she had feared minutes ago.

Still at her desk, the receptionist handed her some new paperwork, a map of the school, and gave her directions on where to go for her first class and what paperwork to give to which teacher. After all that, she returned to her routine tasks.

Berry could only stumble out of the office marveling at how much better it had all gone than she had feared. They had been quite friendly and, more importantly, not really interested in her. They had taken the the paperwork and processed it, not examined it for error. In some respects they had been nothing but mindless drones, just like John had predicted.

Berry's luck was not so good when she presented herself to the teacher of her first class, a man of some years. He snapped at her and read over the paperwork in a bad mood. But he was still a drone (even if an unfriendly one), just like the people in the office. He took the paperwork at its false word and merely gave Berry a bad time for the extra work he would now have to do.

Berry for her part found him nowhere near as scary as the office had been. He might be a burden on her life for months in the future, but even if she had no memory of them at all, she knew she had been dealing with teachers for a decade, and somehow that knowledge was still with her (even if she couldn't remember any of it). This teacher was just something she would have to endure, not be scared of.

Now her classmates were a different matter. Surely some time in her past, Berry was seen a new student when she joined a class. Maybe she had been the one. But no memories surfaced to soothe her worries as she was introduced to the class. There was no sign in the sea of faces that she was regarded as anything important. Having some friends would be nice, but right now Berry was willing to settle for a lack of enemies. As she returned to her seat, she thought she was getting that wish at least.
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Berry's first day of school

choices: Berry talks to the library club members
Iris is concerned about Berry and goes to the library to find her
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
Berry's next class was much like her first. The teacher was friendlier, but he still just marked her name down as a member of the class, assigned her work to make up for missed weeks, and effectively forgot about her. The students also just noticed her presence and resumed their lives..mostly. As Berry left the class on her way to her next, she realized there was somebody at her elbow. The tap came from a girl with brunette colored hair and green eyes, about 5'5" or so in height.

"Hi, I'm Karen. I'm with the Foreign Exchange Club. We'd like you to come to our next meeting. It's in two days."

The Foreign Exchange Club! She had been specifically warned to avoid them. These were precisely the people who would know too much about her false past.

"We have never had a student from Schleswig. What's it like there?" the cheerful girl asked of Berry. To Berry, this was just the start of many questions she felt she would be unable to answer entirely, and only some of them would be possible for her to answer at all. Fortunately this was one she could give a trite answer to, and Karen didn't have time to answer more. She had to get to her own class, giving Berry all the information she needed about the meeting first.

Crisis averted, for the moment. But she had been spotted by the "enemy". Would it be wiser to deal with them directly, or avoid them? Either way, suspicion could be aroused all too easily. Berry will need advice on the subject.

Lunch was after the next class and Iris was there to help her, as well as introduce her to her friends. If things worked out, she would blend in with them.

No such luck. Berry wasn't aware why students formed cliques: she was barely aware they did. She was only aware that this was not her clique, which is why she had trouble saying much of anything. They were mostly younger than her, and a little more noisy than they should be...but there was still the fact was that she just didn't fit in. Maybe they didn't purposely want to drive her away, but it seemed to her that all the parties would be happier if she went elsewhere. But where?

That is when someone mentions the library club [in a rather disparaging tone].

"There is a library on campus?" Berry asked a girl who brought up the library.

"Yeah, it's a place where all the nerds hang out." [and obviously not where the speaker had any intention of hanging out.]

"Hmm, one of my teachers said I should visit the library...but he didn't say if it was on campus or not." [Was that a good recovery? Or another hint something was wrong about her story? Well, she was stuck with it either way.] "Can you give me directions?"

Directions were given, and nobody except Iris was disappointed when she left soon afterward. She may be going off on her own into unexplored territory, but she was sure the library was where she should be.

And it was a quite impressive place. Berry had no memory that she had ever gone to a high school, much less if it had a library, but she was fairly sure that if it had, it was much inferior to this one. She was definitely impressed as she marched in.

The clerk at the desk, a quiet lady, asked if she could help her when she approached the desk.

"Yes, I understand you have a library club..."
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Berry's trouble with "blending in"

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
The woman at the desk asked "You're a student here?"

"Yes, I'm an exchange student. I just registered today."

"You'll need to fill out these forms. You may only check out one book today. Once that is returned, you may check out 3 a day. Library club members are allowed to... There is more, rattled off rapidly in none too friendly a manner. Like she suspected Berry of wanting to steal her precious books... Berry wouldn't think of doing that...well, unless it was really interesting anyway... But it ends with "Now you will want to see Lance over there about the Library Club." With that, she almost rudely ignored Berry as she turned to other matters.

Berry might have felt insulted if she was not already on her way to Lance. Reaching him she introduces herself "Excuse me, you're Lance? I'm Berry and I am wanting to join the Library club."

Lance, a rather good looking blond she had to look up to [By the standards of her romance novels, he was only fair. Still...], smiles as he answers "OK, you can help me with shelving these books. All members of the club put in volunteer hours helping with the library. You have your application form? You write in 3 hours a week you can be here. A lot of us put in 5. You ever done any shelving?"

Berry answers with the safe "not much." and gets a short lecture on what amounts to grunt work. Then the two of them got to work putting books on the shelves. Not exactly complex work, but Berry rather wondered if she had done it in her blank past. Some things just seemed so obvious... until she asked herself why. On the other hand, some things seemed so wrong. Three times she read a book's subject and started to go to the wrong section with it until she read the coding number. It was like she had learned the code, and now somebody had changed half of it.
Lance was nice enough and had a number of jokes that were funny, without being too funny to tell in the library. But the biggest joke was on Berry, and even if she was the only one who understood it, she didn't feel like laughing.

"OK, time for me to go." Lance announced. "You can help Karen now."

"Karen?" Berry answered, hoping she didn't sound as horrified as felt. Maybe over nothing. There had to be a dozen Karens in a school this big.

"Sure," a possibly oblivious Larry answered as he dragged Berry towards a figure that was looking entirely too familiar. "She's our membership secretary."

"Karen, this is Berry. She's joining the Library Club."

"We've met." the cheerful Karen informed Lance before turning to Berry "Glad to see you again. Between the Foreign Exchange Club and the Library Club, we'll get to see lots of each other."

Berry could do little but try to make her smile look sincere. Talk about putting her foot right in the trap. Her very first day and she had practically forced her way into the spotlight in front of those most likely to expose her. Should she just confess all and cut the torture short? No, she couldn't do that. But Iris was willing to help. Maybe Karen would be too.
And maybe not. Betting everything on the mercy of a stranger was not a good idea, but the alternative was to outwit a roomful of people who knew more than she did. That wasn't a good prospect either. Things were not looking well...
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Berry talks to the library club members

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
Things soon looked worse for Berry. Karen liked to ask questions; rather personal questions, too. If she had been a little less friendly, Berry would have called her downright nosy. But Berry just wasn't the type to tell her the answer was none of her friend's business. She tried to dodge as best she could with vague answers and with being too "eager" to work to talk, but these attempts weren't working, either. With every question, and every inadequate answer, Berry could just see Karen getting more and more suspicious. Berry could only cling to a shrinking hope that somehow she could pull it off.

Finally Karen asked a question with some foreign phrase in it. Berry chose to nod in agreement in hopes that was the right answer. It apparently wasn't. aren put her hands on her hips.

"That settles it. You don't know German! They did a totally inadequate job on preparing you."

She knows everything! Everything is about to be exposed!

"You ...won't tell... Will you?"

"Of course not", Karen answered. "That would be almost criminal."

"Thank you, ... so much." Berry was about ready to kiss the other girl in relief. Only Karen's stern attitude held her back.

"I suppose that since I am the one that exposed you, I'm stuck with the job of repairing your cover story", Karen grumbled, though her expression suggested she might be eager to do that job. "We can't talk here. Meet me in study room B in an hour."

What was going on here? Berry was only sure she was not being immediately exposed and so agreed as they returned to their work. She worried all the way through her next class, which fortunately seemed to be an easy one. Then she approached study room B with trepidation. Karen was waiting for her, several books in her hands.

"These should cover what you should know about your 'background'. Take them home with you and study them," Karen ordered Berry. "Be careful with them because they are out on my card. So bring any back that you have already read during your training under the Witness Protection Program."

As Karen kept talking, it suddenly all made a lot more sense to Berry. Karen thought that she and her family were important witnesses in some big criminal case, so she was willing to help protect her from the evil..whatever. Not that unusual an attitude. Berry could recall thrilling to a romance novel on that theme in which...oh bother. She can't remember it, and it had been a favorite of hers, too. Well, it hardly matters now. What was important was that her cover was not nearly as blown as she thought. Berry might not know much about the Witness Protection Program (well, beyond there was such a thing), but Karen likely didn't know much more. She could just let Karen fool herself and she would be safe...

...but was that really fair? Karen was obviously planning to do a lot of work. Could she just take advantage of her like that? It might be smart, but it didn't seem right.

"Don't see how we can avoid the Foreign Exchange Club", Karen was saying. "I've already blabbed that you would be there, so your absence will be way suspicious. I suppose you could call in sick, but you can't be sick one day every week. So we are going to have to come up with a speech that will satisfy most of the question."

"Karen", Berry interrupted, "I'm really grateful for all the help you are offering, but I don't want to take advantage of you. I don't know what I can do, but I should at least tell you what you are getting into."

"No," Karen answered. "Anything you tell me is just another leak and a danger to you."

"Maybe..." Berry responded, "But I think that not knowing would really eat at you, and I don't want to cause you pain when I can avoid it so easily. Think about it. If you really would like to know, and swore to keep your promise not to tell no matter what...I can show you everything."
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Foreign study

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
"No, you don't need to tell me a thing", Karen assured Berry. 'I can live with not knowing. Tho..."

"No. It would be a bad idea for you to te...

"I really shouldn't...."

"Well, if you insist on telling me..."

Berry managed to avoid saying she was not insisting at all. Letting Karen know was probably a terrible idea. But what else could she do? She couldn't just take all of Karen's help and do nothing in return, and she was surely right. Karen would keep poking and trying to find out even as she tried to stop Berry from exposing herself. That seemed even more likely to lead to trouble. "OK, meet me at the SW corner of the parking lot after the last class. But it's really important that you say nothing to anybody. We just walked home and discussed ... my speech in two days. You promise? Really, really promise?"

Karen was agreeable, in fact thrilled, to be entrusted with this secret, one that was both worse and better than she probably thought. To Berry's surprise, Karen left acting as if she owed Berry a favor. That was distinctly shocking, but Berry was not going to be too upset by good news. There was too much other stuff to worry about. Gathering up the books she would have to study, she headed off to her next class.

The end of the school day found Berry frazzled, but there had no more disasters or near disasters. She could at least hope that she could get by. But for now she had to deal with Karen.

Karen was waiting when Berry arrived at the appointed spot, a fact Berry suspected measured their relative eagerness. At least she had been in no rush. And Karen seemed to be almost dancing with excitement.

"Come along. We'll join the others", Berry told the pumped up lass as she moved towards where she saw Iris and Ryan waiting.

"Ooo..." Karen enthused, "Multiple meeting points. I remember that from a movie in which..."

Berry found herself surprisingly interested in Karen's description of the show. It described spy activity in what Berry was sure was horribly inaccurate, but Karen did make it sound great. But now she was face to face with a worried Iris and Ryan.

"These are my friends Iris and Ryan. Guys, this is Karen, who will be coming home with me."

"Is that wise?" an even more worried Ryan asked.

"Probably not," Berry admitted, "But I don't see an alternative. Karen exposed me in nothing flat, and now she wants to help. She needs to know what she is getting into."

"More and more people..." Ryan muttered, and then shrugged, "Well, we can't stay here. Come on."

As Ryan led the girls away from the school, Karen was feeling upset, disappointed as much as anything. She had been thinking of scary men in dark coats, a terrified family, or even some faceless aliens. To find herself dealing with some other kids was not quite what she had expected. But in a block or so, Ryan would announce something that would change her life forever.

"This is good enough", he proposed as he pulled out the box. "Berry, you want Karen with you?"

"She might as well get the whole experience." Iris answered. Turning to Karen, she continued, "Relax, you'll enjoy it. I did."

Karen was not at all assured by this. In fact, it sounded like a reason to turn and run. But she could only think of all sorts of childish things this might be. She would never be able to live with herself if she ran and all this was that she... well, had to eat a bug or something. And there was that secret of Berry's she wanted to know... So she didn't move as Ryan put this box to his lips and said,

"Karen, 2 inches."

He then put the box on the ground telling Karen,

"Just stand next to it, please. I don't think it would hurt if you stood on it, but I don't want to take the chance."

Now what was this all about? They all seemed to be expecting something. Karen thought that she might as well follow orders, even if they were from a mere boy.

"Like this?" Karen asked as she put a foot on each side of the box.

"That might work very well." Ryan answered. "Now this takes a couple of minutes the first time..."

Karen still was unsure if she should be running for her life, or marching away from people who were trying to make a fool of her, but she couldn't see any reason to do either. All she had was this vague suspicion...until she realized she was looking up at people she had been looking down at...
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Karen and Berry's secret

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
What was going on? How could everybody be growing like this? Then Karen noticed that all the objects she that could be seen are "growing" too, and she realizes she must be shrinking...But how? And what should she do?

"Now don't worry", Iris again insisted [Easy for her to say. She wasn't the one it was happening to.] "Both Berry and I have been shrunk and regrown too. It's nothing you need to be scared of."

Karen was hardly convinced. In fact, about all that kept her from running was confusion about which way. But now another problem was developing; that little box between her feet was "growing", and she was having problems keeping her balance as her legs were stretched further and further apart. Finally she had to raise a foot, and when it came down, it was inside the box.

"Yes, that should save us some time", Ryan approved. Karen doubted she did, but now the box side between her legs was getting "taller", and Karen had to move her other leg to avoid the "rising" edge. She was not quite quick enough and misjudged the rate of "growth" - the next thing she knew, she was flat on her back in the box, which briefly, and uncomfortably, seemed about coffin sized. To her relief, she continued to shrink until it seemed like she was inside a small room.

"Berry, 2 inches", seemed to boom from above her. Looking up, she saw that a giant Berry was now in the position she had been a moment ago. As she watched, Berry became smaller and closer until a "normal" sized Berry was once again standing next to her. Then the lid slammed shut.

"Berry, what is this? What is going on?" Karen asked, in almost a combination of a shout and a whisper. She held onto Berry with a death grip, as the only familiar thing in a world gone mad.

"Nothing really", Berry tried to explain. "I guess I should have explained a little better in advance, but..."

"Being shrunk to the size of an ant is nothing?"

"It is when you are going to be unshrunk once we get inside Ryan's house. Now just relax and I'll explain what I know, which isn't that much..."

It did not take long, and Karen was soon repeating the basics, more to get a grip on herself than to actually make sure she understood.

"...there were 5 of you, all dolls, in this box that Ryan bought. And he can use the box to grow you to most any size. Right now you are living in a magic doll house, but are trying to fit in to normal life before somebody finds you and makes a big fuss?"

"Pretty much."

"...and you have no memories of your past, just a feeling that Ryan saved you each from something terrible...?"

"Well, we remember a little. I know I have always read a lot, and can almost remember a little about the books, but the details just don't seem to be there when I try to remember them. But yeah, I remember pretty much nothing. I have no idea about the important things, like family, friends, and such."

"This is a lot to take in", Karen sighed. "It's quite a shock." As she said that, she realized her main sentiment was not shock, but disappointment. This was not some big dramatic conspiracy: just five girls who wanted to live normal lives, or at least sort of. All very dull and disappointing.

Still, it was five girls that needed a lot of help, help that she could provide. And there were secrets involved, even if they were secrets that nobody should need to know.

"OK, I'm still in."

"I'm glad to hear that", Berry enthused. "We can sure use all the help we can get. Thanks..."

"Oh by the way, what was that German phrase you used to trip me up? Somebody else may use it on me."
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: Back in the box

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
"I don't know, not exactly anyway" Karen admitted. "And I am not going to find out, not if I can help it."
"Ooo, that sounds like a good story." Berry enthused. "Please tell me."
Karen considered, "Well... I didn't promise not to tell anybody but Mom, and really, it's too long ago anyway... But you are still going to have to promise not to pass it on."
When Berry gave the needed promise, Karen spilled. "I was just a little kid when my family took a trip to Germany, and one day during it, Dad was driving somewhere with me in the back seat. At a stop sign, I heard a woman shout that phrase, and I got up and leaned out the window to see who it was.
"At the time, all I realized was that the lady must be really cold because she was missing about half her clothes. She saw me and giggled. Then she said something I didn't catch, but from her gesture I assume meant something like 'guess not'.
"Dad had hardly driven away before I was asking him what ...that phrase... meant. I"ve always been pretty good at repeating what I hear, and I must have repeated it perfectly that time as dad just about had a heart attack. When he recovered, he ordered me never to say that again. And he also made me promise not to mention the lady or anything about her to Mom. Then we stopped for an ice cream soda, which I was also not to mention to Mom. ...Those are promises I kept by the way, just as I will keep those to you.
"Now you might have reacted in several ways when you heard it, shock, embarrassment, confusion..., but the only reason you would have reacted as you did was if you had absolutely no idea what I had said. You were completely busted."
"Yes, that is clear enough... Oh! We're here!" Berry announced as the lid was removed and Karen could see they were no longer on the street, but in what seemed like the largest room in the world.
"Berry! How did we get here? I didn't feel us move at all."
Berry shrugged. "I don't know either, but we don't feel much or anything that goes on outside when we are inside. It's just one of the things we don't understand and have to take advantage of.
"Now come on. Let's go meet the others."
It turned out the girls need to be resized, but soon Karen found herself in front of a huge mansion. Measuring by the colossal size of Ryan, it must actually be only a few feet tall, but she had seen apartment buildings that seemed smaller than this. Almost intimidated, Karen entered behind Berry.
"Girls! We have a visitor!" Berry shouted. For a moment, there was silence. Then there was a whoop from the top of the stairs and Karen looked up to see a lass sliding down the banister, in a rather out of control manner yet. Somehow she managed to dismount without disaster, a feat Karen was sure was more due to luck than skill. "Karen, this is Amy." Berry introduced the two, "She can be a bit enthusiastic at times."
"Great to have you come by." Amy announced. "It can get dull being stuck in this house all day." With that, Amy turned back to the stairs "Hey Scaredy-cat! Come on down! It's safe. She won't bite!"
Karen looked up to the top of the stairs to see a younger girl peering cautiously around the corner. "That is Emelia." Berry informed Karen, and then turned to Amy, "I thought you promised not to call her that."
"Poo!" Amy responded. "She's used to it, or ought to be. And she does need me to protect her, just like I used to protect my ... !@#$, can't recall it. Oh well..." Amy turned back to the stairs "Come on. I'll protect you."
Somewhat hesitantly, the girl did come down to be introduced to Karen. She gained confidence as she did, but Karen still judged her meek to an extreme.
"If you would excuse my interruption..." What was this? Another one?
1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.title: "Not a chance."

1133121111211112112111112112112211111221.content:
